</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The full CG&#038;N Committee
    Charter is available at www.agrium.com under &#147;Corporate
    Governance&#148;
    </FONT>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
The mandate of the CG&#038;N Committee is to assist the Board in fulfilling its responsibilities relating to continuing review and development of Agrium&#146;s corporate governance system. Responsibilities of the CG&#038;N Committee include:<BR><BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -9pt; margin-left: 9pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing and developing the Guidelines, Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for directors, officers and employees, the Charters for our Board and its Committees, as well as Terms of Reference for our Board Chair, Committee Chairs, individual directors and the CEO;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing and recommending to the Board any reports on compliance with the governance guidelines and requirements of applicable regulators and securities exchanges;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing and recommending director compensation for Board and Committee service, and overseeing the administration of the DSU Plans (defined below);
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;annually evaluating the overall performance of the Board, the Board Chair, the Board Committees, the Committee Chairs, and individual directors;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;monitoring the relationship between management and the Board to ensure that the Board is able to, and in fact does, function independently of management;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;assisting the Board in identifying and recommending qualified individuals to become Board members, consistent with criteria approved by the Board, and to recommend to the Board persons for nomination to the Board;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;providing recommendations as to the size, composition, operation and effectiveness of the Board and its Committees, and identifying and making recommendations respecting the appointment of members to Board Committees;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;developing and implementing an orientation and ongoing education program for directors;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">

</TD>

</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;ensuring that Board Committees and individual directors engage outside advisors as needed; and
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">

</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -4pt; margin-left: 4pt">
<DIV style="text-indent: 0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt;">
&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing the CG&#038;N Committee Charter on an annual basis.<BR><BR>See &#147;Section Three: Corporate Governance&#148; for a description of the Guidelines, Board Charter and Terms of Reference for the Corporation&#146;s Board Chair, Committee Chairs, individual directors and CEO.
</DIV>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">

<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
The accomplishments and key activities of the CG&#038;N Committee in 2009 included the following:<BR><BR>

    and updated the Board Composition Matrix and director succession

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -4pt; margin-left: 4pt">
    <B>&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;Evaluation of the Board, Committees,
    Board/Committee Chairs, and Individual Directors<BR>
    <BR>
    </B>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;assessed
    director independence against categorical standards and reviewed
    director relationships, commitments and interlocks;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;conducted
    an evaluation for the Board, Board Committees, and Board and
    Committee Chairs, and individual directors; and<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;assessed
    and updated, as appropriate, the Board and Committee Charters,
    Corporate Governance Guidelines, and the Board Manual.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    &#149; <B>Corporate Governance Best Practices<BR>
    <BR>
    </B>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;monitored
    recent developments, emerging trends, and best practices in
    corporate governance and disclosure practices;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed,
    assessed, and enhanced the directors&#146; continuing education
    process; and<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;assessed
    relationships between each director and the Corporation and
    recommended to the Board that eleven out of twelve nominees
    named in this Circular are independent.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">

    <BR>

    and approved for recommendation to the Board the corporate
    governance disclosures contained in the Circular.

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Membership Criteria</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Each member of the CG&#038;N Committee is required by the
    Charter to be independent within the meaning of the CSA Rules
    and the NYSE Listing Standards.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">

<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Compensation Consultant</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Consultant Retained.</B> The CG&#038;N Committee retained
    Towers Watson (formerly Towers Perrin) in the most recent fiscal
    year to assist with reviews of Board compensation. See
    &#147;Human Resources &#038; Compensation Committee&#148;
    (below) for details with respect to the duties performed by
    Towers Watson for the Corporation in 2009.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">

<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Advisors</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The CG&#038;N Committee is empowered to engage outside advisors
    and/or consultants at the Corporation&#146;s expense, to assist
    the CG&#038;N Committee and/or provide advice on any matter
    within its mandate. The CG&#038;N Committee Chair leads the
    selection of these outside consultants and advisors, and the
    CG&#038;N Committee has the sole authority to retain and
    terminate such consultants or advisors, including the authority
    to approve their fees and other retention terms.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Meetings</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The CG&#038;N Committee met on four occasions in 2009 and held
    <I>in camera </I>sessions without management present on four
    occasions (following every regularly scheduled meeting). In
    addition to holding <I>in camera </I>sessions following every
    regularly scheduled meeting, CG&#038;N Committee procedure
    allows any director to move the Committee to an <I>in camera
    </I>session at any time during a meeting.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">

    <B>Availability of Committee</B>

    Meeting to answer Shareholders&#146; inquiries in the areas
    covered by the CG&#038;N Committee&#146;s mandate.

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='141'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Human
    Resources&#160;&#038; Compensation Committee (the
    &#147;HR&#038;C Committee&#148;)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="24%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="74%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<!-- TableOutputHead -->
<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Members</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    R. J. Horner (Chair)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;G.
    Gibara&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;D. G. Pannell <BR>
    S. A.
    Henry&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;V.
    J. Zaleschuk, CA
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Concurrent with his appointment to the CG&#038;N Committee, Dr.
    Cunningham ceased to be a member of the HR&#038;C Committee on
    May 13, 2009. There were no other changes to the membership of
    the HR&#038;C Committee in 2009.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Charter</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The mandate, procedure and composition requirements of the
    HR&#038;C Committee are set out in its Charter.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The full HR&#038;C Committee
    Charter is available at www.agrium.com under &#147;Corporate
    Governance&#148;
    </FONT>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The mandate of the HR&#038;C Committee is to assist the Board in
    fulfilling its responsibilities relating to human resources
    matters. Responsibilities of the HR&#038;C Committee include:<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;advising on human resources and
    compensation philosophies, strategies and principles, including
    the review of compensation policies and programs for
    employees;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing and approving the
    CEO&#146;s goals and objectives, assessing the CEO&#146;s
    performance, and recommending the CEO&#146;s compensation;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;overseeing the evaluation of
    management, including recommendations to the Board regarding the
    appointment of and the compensation arrangements for
    executives;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;assessing executive succession
    plans and practices;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing and making
    recommendations with respect to incentive compensation and
    equity compensation plans and programs;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing and approving the
    investment, funding and benefits policies relating to retirement
    plans;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;overseeing the preparation of the
    Compensation Discussion &#038; Analysis
    (&#147;<B>CD&#038;A</B>&#148;) and related compensation
    disclosure; and<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing the HR&#038;C Committee
    Charter on an annual basis.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>2009 Accomplishments and Key Activities</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The accomplishments and key activities of the HR&#038;C
    Committee in 2009 included the following:<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;<B>Compensation<BR>
    <BR>
    </B>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed
    compensation policies and programs with consideration for (i)
    the Corporation&#146;s continued growth, and (ii) evolving
    compensation disclosure regulation and best-practices guidelines
    for executive compensation;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed a
    thorough look-back and look-forward analysis of CEO compensation
    relative to company performance to ensure a strong link exists
    between compensation and performance;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed
    executive termination analysis to ensure a clear understanding
    of implications and appropriateness of costs under the various
    termination scenarios;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;implemented
    an option and SAR granting policy;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;evaluated
    the CEO&#146;s performance and made compensation recommendations
    to the Board;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed
    evaluations of executives&#146; performance and recommended
    compensation packages to the Board; and<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;evaluated
    the services and independence of the compensation consultant
    engaged by the HR&#038;C Committee.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    &#149; <B>Human Resources Strategies and Policies<BR>
    <BR>
    </B>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed
    the Corporation&#146;s human resources strategies and programs
    in light of the different cultural and economic environments in
    which it operates.
</TD>
</TR>

</TD>

    &#149; <B>Governance and Disclosure<BR>
    <BR>
    </B>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed
    new and emerging compensation regulations and the
    recommendations of various shareholder governance groups and
    made or is considering appropriate changes to continually
    enhance the governance of the compensation program;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed
    emerging trends with respect to an executive compensation
    clawback policy and reviewed the form of policy implemented in
    2010;<BR>

    the &#147;Say on Pay&#148; developments through the past year
    and decided to provide Shareholders an opportunity to vote on a
    non-binding advisory resolution on executive compensation at the
    Meeting;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed
    and approved the CD&#038;A and related compensation disclosure
    to be included in the Circular, including additional voluntary
    disclosure relating to executive and director compensation;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed
    officer equity ownership relative to established guidelines;
    and<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed
    the HR&#038;C Committee Charter and Work Plan.<BR>
    <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;See <B>Schedule &#147;D&#148; </B>for the
    detailed Work Plan of the HR&#038;C Committee.

<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">

<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Membership Criteria</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B>Independence.</B> Each member of the HR&#038;C Committee is required to be independent within the meaning of the CSA Rules and the NYSE Listing Standards.  In addition, the CEO does not participate in the appointment of members to the HR&#038;C Committee.<BR><BR><B>Interlocks.</B> None of Agrium&#146;s executive officers has served as a member of a compensation committee (or equivalent committee) of any other entity that employs a member of the HR&#038;C Committee.<BR><BR><B>Sitting CEOs.</B> None of the HR&#038;C Committee&#146;s members are currently active chief executive officers of publicly traded companies.</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Human Resource and Financial Literacy of Members</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    HR&#038;C Committee members are appointed with a view to
    ensuring that the Committee maintains an appropriate level of
    financial and human resources literacy. All members of the
    HR&#038;C Committee are knowledgeable about Agrium&#146;s
    compensation programs.  Mr. Zaleschuk is considered by the Board
    to have financial expertise and has been designated as an
    &#147;audit committee financial expert&#148; for the purpose of
    the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002.  All of the members of the
    Committee are &#147;financially literate&#148; within the
    meaning of MI 52-110, and have been determined by the Committee
    to possess human resources literacy, meaning a thorough
    understanding of compensation theory and practice, people
    development and management, succession planning and executive
    development. Such knowledge and capability includes (i) current
    or prior experience working as chief executive or senior
    officers of major organizations (which provide significant
    financial and human resources experience), (ii) involvement on
    board compensation committees of other entities, and (iii)
    experience and education pertaining to financial accounting and
    reporting and familiarity with internal financial controls.  See
    the directors&#146; biographies on pages&#160;4 through 9 for
    additional information.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    28
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 90%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->
<!-- XBRL Table Pagebreak -->

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="24%">&nbsp;</TD>         <!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>  <!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>  <!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="74%">&nbsp;</TD>         <!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<!-- TableOutputHead -->
<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>Advisors</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    The HR&#038;C Committee is empowered to engage outside advisors
    and/or consultants at the Corporation&#146;s expense, to assist
    the HR&#038;C Committee and/or provide advice on any matter
    within its mandate.  The HR&#038;C Committee Chair leads the
    selection of these outside consultants and advisors, and the
    HR&#038;C Committee has the sole authority to retain and
    terminate such consultants or advisors, including the authority
    to approve their fees and other retention terms.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Compensation Consultant</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B>Consultant Retained.</B> The HR&#038;C Committee retained Towers Watson (formerly Towers Perrin) in the most recent fiscal year to assist with preparing information and providing advice on senior executive and director compensation arrangements.  Materials provided by Towers Watson have been presented by Towers Watson and/or management to the HR&#038;C Committee for its independent review and approval.  Towers Watson&#146;s scope of services includes competitive reviews of senior executive and Board compensation levels, assisting management with changes to the design of compensation programs, providing trend information and other miscellaneous executive compensation assistance. See &#147;Section Four: Executive Compensation&#160;&#151; 2009 Compensation Discussion &#038; Analysis&#160;&#151; Compensation Process&#148; for details with respect to the duties performed by Towers Watson in 2009.<BR><BR><B>Independence. </B>The HR&#038;C Committee has determined that Towers Watson is independent from Agrium ma
nagement and is satisfied that it receives impartial and independent advice from Towers Watson on all matters relating to executive compensation. In 2009, Towers Watson earned U.S.$255,000 in fees for executive compensation services and U.S.$903,000 for retirement and pension consulting services. The total fees represent less than 1% of Towers Watson&#146;s total annual revenue.<BR><BR><B>Pre-Approval of Services.</B> The HR&#038;C Committee is required to pre-approve any services requested by management from any compensation consultants engaged by the HR&#038;C Committee.  The HR&#038;C Committee will not approve any work that, in its view, could compromise the independence of the compensation consultants engaged to advise the HR&#038;C Committee. <BR><BR><B>Quarterly Meetings with the HR&#038;C Committee Chair.</B> The Chair of the HR&#038;C Committee meets privately with the HR&#038;C Committee&#146;s compensation consultant each quarter to review ongoing compensation work and any proposed additional serv
ices, including any matters related to NEO compensation.</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Evaluation of Consultant.</B> The HR&#038;C Committee
    conducts an annual evaluation of the performance and
    independence of its external compensation consultant.  In
    connection with the completion of the 2009 compensation year,
    the HR&#038;C Committee evaluated the services of Towers Watson
    and determined that it was satisfied with the effectiveness of
    the performance of Towers Watson.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Meetings</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The HR&#038;C Committee met on four occasions in 2009 and held
    <I>in camera </I>sessions without management present on four
    occasions (following every regularly scheduled meeting).  In
    addition to holding <I>in camera </I>sessions following every
    regularly scheduled meeting, HR&#038;C Committee procedure
    allows any director to move the Committee to an <I>in camera
    </I>session at any time during a meeting.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">

    <B>Availability of Committee</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Members of the HR&#038;C Committee will be available at the
    Meeting to answer Shareholders&#146; inquiries in the areas
    covered by the HR&#038;C Committee&#146;s mandate.
</TD>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='142'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Environment,
    Health, Safety&#160;&#038; Security Committee (the
    &#147;EHS&#038;S Committee&#148;)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="24%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="74%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<!-- TableOutputHead -->
<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <B>Members</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
S.A. Henry (Chair)        R.J. Horner&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;F.W. Proto<BR>A.A. McLellan&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;D.G. Pannell<BR><BR>On May 13, 2009, in connection with Dr.&#160;D. Grant Devine&#146;s retirement from the Board and as a member of EHS&#038;S Committee, Mr. D.G. Pannell was appointed to the EHS&#038;S Committee. There were no other changes to the membership of the EHS&#038;S Committee in 2009.</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Charter</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The mandate, procedure and composition requirements of the
    EHS&#038;S Committee are set out in its Charter.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 5pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The full EHS&#038;S Committee
    Charter is available at www.agrium.com under &#147;Corporate
    Governance&#148;
    </FONT>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The mandate of the EHS&#038;S Committee is to assist the Board
    in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities in order to ensure
    the Corporation&#146;s activities are conducted in an
    environmentally responsible manner and that the Corporation
    maintains the integrity of its health, safety and security
    policies.  Responsibilities of the EHS&#038;S Committee
    include:<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;annually reviewing and recommending to
    the Board for approval the Environment, Health, Safety &#038;
    Security Policy;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;monitoring environmental, health and
    safety performance, compliance with legal and regulatory
    requirements, as well as applicable industry standards relating
    to environmental, health and safety matters, and reviewing the
    strategies and methods used to improve our environmental,
    health, safety and security performance;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing our environmental, health,
    safety and security performance goals, management systems
    implementation, audit programs and plans, and the status of our
    remediation projects and provisions;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing the methods of communicating
    our environmental, health, safety and security policies and
    procedures throughout the organization; and<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewing the EHS&#038;S Committee
    Charter on an annual basis.<BR>
    <BR>
    In addition, it is the practice of the EHS&#038;S Committee to
    arrange at least one visit annually for our Board members to one
    of our facilities, which includes orientation sessions to
    personally acquaint members of the Committee and the Board with
    personnel and operations at our facilities.<BR>
    <BR>
    The Corporation has a corporate environment, health, safety
    &#038; security committee composed of members of senior
    management which is responsible for ensuring that we conduct our
    activities and operate our facilities in an environmentally
    responsible manner and maintain the integrity of our health,
    safety and security policies.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    30

<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>2009 Accomplishments and Key Activities</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    The accomplishments and key activities of the EHS&#038;S
    Committee in 2009 included the following:<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;oversaw the Corporation&#146;s best
    EHS&#038;S performance in 2009 over prior years against
    identified key performance indicators;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed the EHS&#038;S integration
    activities related to the Corporation&#146;s recent
    acquisitions, and in particular the implementation of enhanced
    focus on safety in Royster-Clark and UAP, resulting in improved
    EHS&#038;S performance in those entities;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed and assessed a strengthened
    Environmental Management System and strong performance within
    each of the strategic business units;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;conducted a site visit to UAP&#146;s
    Loveland, Colorado formulation facility;<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed, in conjunction with the Audit
    Committee, the Corporation&#146;s classification, accounting and
    reporting processes, and key controls, relating to Asset
    Retirement Obligations and Environmental Remediation Liabilities
    in preparation for conversion to International Financial
    Reporting Standards in 2011; and<BR>
    <BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;commissioned and reviewed an external
    assessment of the Corporation&#146;s EHS&#038;S governance
    practices.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Membership Criteria</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Each member of the EHS&#038;S Committee is required by the
    Charter to be independent within the meaning of the CSA Rules
    and the NYSE Listing Standards.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Advisors</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The EHS&#038;S Committee is empowered to engage outside advisors
    and/or consultants at the Corporation&#146;s expense, to assist
    the EHS&#038;S Committee and/or provide advice on any matter
    within its mandate.  The EHS&#038;S Committee Chair leads the
    selection of these outside consultants and advisors, and the
    EHS&#038;S Committee has the sole authority to retain and
    terminate such consultants or advisors, including the authority
    to approve their fees and other retention terms.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">

    <B>Meetings</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
The EHS&#038;S Committee met on four occasions in 2009 and held <I>in camera</I> sessions without management present on four occasions (following every regularly scheduled meeting). In addition to holding <I>in camera</I> sessions following every regularly scheduled meeting, EHS&#038;S Committee procedure allows any director to move the Committee to an <I>in camera</I> session at any time during a meeting.<BR><BR>The EHS&#038;S Committee meets separately with the Director, Environment, Health, Safety &#038; Security, and reports to the Board on such meetings.</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='143'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">2009
    DIRECTOR COMPENSATION: TABLES AND NARRATIVE</FONT></U></B>
</DIV>

</A>
<A name='144'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Director
    Compensation Program</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The director compensation program was designed to reflect the
    responsibilities, commitments and risks accompanying Board
    membership and to assist the Corporation in attracting and
    retaining individuals with necessary experience and abilities.
    Non-executive director compensation is comprised of cash
    retainers and fees (payable in cash or in deferred share units
    (&#147;<B>DSUs</B>&#148;)) and DSU retainers. Please see below
    for a description of the deferred share unit fee plan (the
    &#147;<B>DSU Fee Plan</B>&#148;) (which allows directors to
    elect to receive cash retainers and fees in DSUs instead of
    cash) and the deferred share unit grant plan (the &#147;<B>DSU
    Grant Plan</B>&#148;) (pursuant to which DSU retainers are
    paid). The compensation arrangements for non-executive directors
    in 2009 were as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="79%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="17%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->

</TD>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Notes:</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The Board Chair does not receive
    meeting fees, but attends all Board and Committee meetings.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">A travel allowance of U.S. $1,000
    is paid to each non-executive director who travels out of his or
    her province or state of residence to a meeting site.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The CG&#038;N Committee annually reviews director compensation
    using comparative Canadian and U.S.&#160;data provided by an
    independent compensation consultant (see the section entitled
    &#147;Human Resources&#160;&#038; Compensation Committee&#148;
    (above) for information regarding the consultant retained).
    There were no changes made to director compensation in 2009.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Our Chief Executive Officer, being the only executive director
    of the Corporation, is not entitled to additional compensation
    for performance of director duties. The director compensation
    program is distinct from the executive compensation program and
    non-executive directors are not eligible to receive pensions,
    non-equity incentives, stock options, benefits or perks from the
    Corporation. See &#147;Section&#160;Four: Executive
    Compensation&#148; (below) for a description of the executive
    compensation program.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    32
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>

<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='145'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">2009
    Summary of Director Compensation</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    Compensation Table</B>&#148;) sets out the compensation paid to

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Notes:</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Includes the portion of the
    directors&#146; cash retainers, attendance fees and travel
    allowances paid in cash.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Includes the grant date fair value
    of directors&#146; DSU retainers and the portion of the
    directors&#146; cash retainers, attendance fees and travel
    allowance taken in DSUs. DSUs are granted based on the intended
    cash value, whereby the number of DSUs granted is determined by
    dividing the intended cash value of the grant by the average
    market price (converted to U.S. dollars at the Bank of Canada
    noon rate on the date of grant) of the Common Shares on the TSX
    for the ten trading days preceding the date of grant (the
    &#147;<B>Average Market Price</B>&#148;). As a result, the grant
    date fair value for each grant was calculated on the basis of
    the Average Market Price, being $37.29 (Q1), $40.98 (Q2), $51.47
    (Q3) and $62.11 (Q4), multiplied by the total number of DSUs
    granted. The amounts reported exclude DSUs issued as an
    adjustment for dividends.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(3)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Includes the dollar value of any
    dividends or other earnings paid or payable on share-based
    awards that were not factored into grant date fair value.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(4)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Dr.&#160;Devine retired from the
    Board on May&#160;13, 2009 and the compensation reported is
    compensation paid to Dr.&#160;Devine for services provided prior
    to the date of his retirement.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(5)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">As an executive of Agrium,
    Mr.&#160;Wilson is not paid any director compensation. See
    &#147;Section&#160;Four: Executive Compensation&#148; for
    information regarding compensation paid to Mr.&#160;Wilson in
    his role as CEO of Agrium.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    Cunningham
</DIV>
</TD>

</TD>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Notes:</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The amount reported is the grant
    date fair value of the total DSUs granted (including cash fees
    taken as DSUs and DSU retainers). See note (2)&#160;to the
    Director Compensation Table for a description of the calculation
    of grant date fair value.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Excludes DSUs issued as an
    adjustment for dividends.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(3)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Dr.&#160;Devine retired from the
    Board on May&#160;13, 2009 and the compensation reported is
    compensation paid to Dr.&#160;Devine for services provided prior
    to the date of his retirement.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(4)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The Board Chair does not receive
    meeting fees, but attends all meetings.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<A name='146'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Incentive
    Plan Awards to Directors</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Stock
    Options</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In March 2002, the Board amended the Stock Option Plan (defined
    below) so that non-executive directors would no longer be
    eligible to receive stock options. There are no other stock
    option plans of the Corporation in which the directors are
    eligible to participate. As at March&#160;23, 2010,
    non-executive directors held 10,000 options to acquire Common
    Shares that were granted prior to the March 2002 amendment of
    the Stock Option Plan. These options have exercise prices of
    Cdn.$14.15 and Cdn.$16.01 per share, being the closing prices of
    the Common Shares at the time of the grant, and expire ten years
    after the date of grant.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Deferred
    Share Units</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In December 2001, the Board approved the DSU Fee Plan for all
    directors. The DSU Fee Plan allows directors to elect to receive
    the cash portion of their remuneration in the form of DSUs, cash
    or any combination thereof, subject to having satisfied the
    share ownership requirements set out in our Guidelines. The
    number of DSUs issued each quarter is calculated by dividing the
    electing director&#146;s quarterly remuneration by the market
    value of the Common Shares on the date the director&#146;s
    compensation is converted into DSUs (generally the last business
    day of each quarter). See note (2)&#160;of the Director
    Compensation Table (above) for a description of the calculation
    of market value. A director leaving the Board is entitled to
    receive the then market value of a Common Share for each DSU
    held. During 2009, directors were issued a total of 10,522 DSUs
    under the DSU Fee Plan (including 150 DSUs issued as an
    adjustment for dividends paid on the Common Shares in 2009). See
    <B>Schedule &#147;E&#148; </B>for a comprehensive description of
    the DSU Fee Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In May 2002, the Board approved the DSU Grant Plan which allows
    the Board to grant DSUs to directors. Board members are granted
    DSUs as part of their annual retainer. The number of DSUs issued
    is calculated by dividing the DSU grant value by the market
    value of the Common Shares on the grant date. A director leaving
    the Board is entitled to receive the then market value of a
    Common Share for each DSU held. During 2009, directors were
    issued a total of 16,421 DSUs under the DSU Grant Plan
    (including 411 DSUs issued as an adjustment for dividends paid
    on the Common Shares in 2009). See <B>Schedule &#147;E&#148;
    </B>for a comprehensive description of the DSU Grant Plan.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    34
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Notes:</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The outstanding option-based awards
    shown are fully vested.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">These options have exercise prices
    of Cdn.$14.15 and Cdn.$16.01 per share, which exercise prices
    have been converted to U.S.$ based on the Bank of Canada noon
    rate on the date of grant, being the conversion rate of
    U.S.$1.00 = Cdn.$1.5793 on September&#160;27, 2001 and U.S.$1.00
    = Cdn.$1.5767 on December&#160;6, 2001.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(3)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">&#147;Value of unexercised
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">in-the-money</FONT>
    options&#148; and &#147;Market or payout value of unexercised
    DSUs&#148; was determined by reference to the closing price of
    Common Shares on the NYSE on December&#160;31, 2009, being
    U.S.$61.50 per Common Share. For DSUs, the amount reported
    includes DSUs issued as an adjustment for dividends.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(4)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">All DSUs vest on grant.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(5)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">DSUs are not exercisable until the
    holder ceases to be a member of the Board. The amounts reported
    represent DSUs which were vested but not exercisable in 2009.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">All DSUs vest on grant,
    accordingly, the amounts reported represent the value of all
    DSUs granted in 2009.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(3)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">DSUs are not exercisable until the
    holder ceases to be a member of the Board. The amount that is
    exercisable is the value of DSUs which became exercisable by
    Board members in the fiscal year due to the retirement or
    resignation of a director. With the exception of DSUs held by
    Dr.&#160;Devine (as discussed in Note (4) (below)), no DSUs were
    exercisable by directors in 2009.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(4)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Dr.&#160;Devine retired from the
    Board on May&#160;13, 2009 and all DSUs held by him became
    exercisable upon his retirement.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<A name='147'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Equity
    Ownership Requirements</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Our Guidelines provide that each director is expected to acquire
    and maintain Common Share and DSU ownership with a value of
    approximately five times his or her annual cash retainer within
    five years of their appointment to the Board and to receive
    compensation in DSUs until the minimum equity ownership
    threshold is met.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table sets out the equity ownership interest in
    the Corporation and any changes therein, since our 2009 proxy
    circular disclosure, for each of our independent directors who
    are nominees for election to the Board. In 2009, each of such
    directors increased their equity ownership in the Corporation
    compared to the prior year.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">

    excludes&#160;options.

<A name='148'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">SECTION&#160;FOUR:
    EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Corporation reports its financial results in
    U.S.&#160;dollars. The following CD&#038;A and executive
    compensation disclosure is prepared showing U.S.&#160;dollars,
    except as otherwise noted. Canadian dollars is the currency in
    which the majority of the named executive officers
    (&#147;<B>NEOs</B>&#148;) are paid.
</DIV>

<A name='149'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<A name='150'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Executive
    Summary</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following provides an overview of Agrium&#146;s compensation
    philosophy and program as detailed in the &#147;2009
    Compensation Discussion&#160;&#038; Analysis&#148;:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Agrium&#146;s compensation program is designed to attract and
    retain excellent employees, motivate and reward excellent
    performance, and promote Agrium&#146;s corporate values.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Agrium believes in
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">pay-for-performance</FONT>
    which is why approximately 70% of NEO target compensation is
    &#147;at-risk&#148; and linked to a combination of individual
    and corporate goals and share price performance.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The components of NEO compensation are: base salary, cash-based
    annual incentive awards, equity-based long-term incentives
    (including stock options, stock appreciation rights, and
    performance share units), benefits, perks, and pensions.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    37
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Long-term incentives are used to align executive actions with
    long-term management and Shareholder goals, providing rewards
    consistent with the creation of Shareholder value. They also
    help Agrium to retain executives and meet executive equity
    ownership guidelines.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    All elements of the executive compensation program are targeted
    to provide compensation opportunities to executives near the
    median of their designated peer group. Actual payouts under
    these programs can be above or below the median based on
    individual and company performance. Compensation for outstanding
    performance is targeted near the 75th&#160;percentile of the
    executive&#146;s designated peer group.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Annual performance incentives are linked directly to short-term
    goals and performance, consistent with Agrium&#146;s
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">&#147;pay-for-performance&#148;</FONT>
    philosophy.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    In 2009, despite challenging times in our industry and the
    economy, Agrium delivered its third highest earnings in history
    and was successful in achieving many of its key corporate
    priorities. That being said, Agrium&#146;s executive officers
    (including the NEOs) experienced a substantial decrease in
    annual incentive compensation relative to 2008 due to certain
    corporate financial targets having not been met in 2009.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Executives participate in group benefit programs on
    substantially the same terms as other salaried employees.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Executives are provided with limited perks, such as automobile
    allowances, parking and financial planning, which are provided
    to ensure the compensation mix is competitive with our peers and
    to focus executives on job performance.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Agrium promotes and protects Shareholder interests by, among
    other things, requiring minimum equity ownership by executives,
    prohibiting hedging by executives, and safeguarding against
    insider trading.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The NEOs who are the focus of the CD&#038;A and who appear in
    the compensation tables of the Circular are:
</TD>
</TR>
