</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Determining
    Actual Compensation</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The underlying principle for executive pay throughout the
    Corporation is
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">&#147;pay-for-performance&#148;.</FONT>
    The Corporation sets clearly defined standards of performance
    for all variable elements of total compensation, and annually
    defines the level of performance required to meet threshold,
    target and maximum pay opportunities. The disclosure contained
    herein is focused on the compensation of the NEOs, and the
    performance objectives discussed below are those which were
    applicable in the determination of NEO compensation in 2009.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Where possible, performance is measured using objective
    performance goals. However, in some circumstances subjective
    measures are more appropriate. Where subjective goals are used
    to measure performance and award compensation, they are defined
    in as detailed a manner as possible so that the evaluator (being
    the HR&#038;C Committee for the CEO and the CEO for the other
    NEOs) can use their business judgment to make an appropriate
    assessment on the basis of evidence presented as to the
    achievement of the goal. All senior executives are evaluated
    against a number of objective goals, and no senior executive is
    evaluated solely on the basis of subjective performance goals.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <I><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Corporate
    Performance Objectives</FONT></U></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table (i)&#160;summarizes the corporate
    performance objectives (including the key performance indicators
    &#147;<B>KPIs</B>&#148;) that are linked to NEO compensation
    determinations, (ii)&#160;sets out the Corporation&#146;s
    performance in 2009 as against these objectives,
    (iii)&#160;identifies the link between each goal and overall
    corporate strategy, and (iv)&#160;identifies the pay element(s)
    to which each goal/objective is connected.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    KPIs are set on the basis of the Corporation&#146;s internal
    budget, where: (i)&#160;&#147;<B>Target</B>&#148; level goals
    identify the performance necessary to achieve the
    Corporation&#146;s budget and receive compensation at the Target
    award level (being near the
    50<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">th</SUP>&#160;percentile

    of the applicable peer group),
    (ii)&#160;&#147;<B>Maximum</B>&#148; level goals identify the
    performance necessary to achieve maximum compensation (being
    near the
    75<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">th</SUP>&#160;percentile

    of the applicable peer group), where Maximum goals are generally
    set at 130% of the Target level, and
    (iii)&#160;&#147;<B>Threshold</B>&#148; levels identify the
    point at which reduced compensation is payable and below which
    no compensation is payable for that metric.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    50
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Notes:</B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Information regarding performance
    measures is disclosed in the limited context of annual and
    long-term performance based awards and should not be understood
    to be statements of management&#146;s expectations or estimates
    of results or other guidance. Agrium specifically cautions
    investors not to apply these statements in other contexts.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The Corporation has identified the
    key metrics which are used to determine Profit Sharing Plan and
    Performance Recognition Plan payments. Target level performance
    objectives are intended to be reflective of challenging
    performance in which significant effort is required to
    successfully achieve them (i.e. a 50% chance of exceeding or not
    achieving target). Performance beyond target/plan levels is
    reflective of outstanding performance relative to expectations
    where a sustained level of high performance is required.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(3)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">EBITDA is the Corporation&#146;s
    earnings before interest, income taxes, depreciation,
    amortization and asset impairment and is a non-GAAP measure. The
    Corporation uses EBITDA, among other measures, to assess the
    operating performance of its ongoing businesses without the
    effects of amortization expense, net benefit plans cost, and
    restructuring and other items.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(4)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">ROCE (Return on Capital Employed)
    is a measure of the return generated by the long-term assets and
    net non-cash working capital of Agrium. ROCE is calculated as
    after-tax EBIT divided by the average long-term assets and net
    non-cash working capital over the year. The resulting ratio
    represents the efficiency with which working capital and
    long-term assets are being utilized to generate EBIT.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <I><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NEO
    Performance Objectives</FONT></U></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    NEO performance objectives represent key areas of strategic
    focus for the NEO over the year and are critical to the
    achievement of the Corporation&#146;s business strategy.
    NEO&#146;s individual performance (assessed on the basis of goal
    achievement and responsibilities) is linked to the amount of any
    base salary increase, is a factor in the determination of amount
    of any Performance Recognition Plan payment, and impacts the
    total amount of long-term incentive compensation awarded
    (including grants of options, SARs and PSUs).
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    51
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table (i)&#160;provides a biography of each NEO
    setting out their key areas of corporate responsibility,
    (ii)&#160;provides a summary of any additional 2009 achievements
    of each NEO, and (iii)&#160;sets out each NEO&#146;s performance
    objectives and performance against such objectives in 2009,
    including (if applicable) descriptions of Business Unit
    performance goals for which an NEO is responsible:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="17%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="80%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<!-- TableOutputHead -->
<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD colspan="3" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -8pt; margin-left: 8pt">
    <B>Michael M. Wilson</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <IMG src="o59476o5947658.jpg" alt="(WILSON PHOTO)">
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Biography</B>.&#160;&#160;Michael M. Wilson, President &#038;
    Chief Executive Officer, joined Agrium as Executive Vice
    President and Chief Operating Officer in August of 2000.  Mr.
    Wilson is a graduate of the University of Waterloo, Ontario
    where he earned his degree in Chemical Engineering.  He brings
    over 30&#160;years of international and executive management
    experience in the chemical industry.  Prior to joining Agrium,
    Mr. Wilson was President of Methanex Corporation, a leading
    global producer of methanol headquartered in Vancouver, B.C.  In
    addition, he held various senior positions in North America and
    Asia during his 18&#160;years with Dow Chemical.<BR>
    <BR>
    In addition to the achievement of the individual objectives set
    out below, under Mr. Wilson&#146;s leadership, Agrium was
    recognized as the 2007 Canadian Dealmaker of the Year for the
    Materials Industry in connection with the UAP transaction.  In
    addition, Mr. Wilson was named Calgary businessman of the year
    in 2008.<BR>
    <BR>
    Since Mr. Wilson was appointed President and Chief Executive
    Officer of the Corporation in 2003, its market capitalization
    has increased from $1.58 billion to $9.66 billion as at December
    31, 2009.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="42%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="7%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="48%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=maindata -->

<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<!-- TableOutputHead -->
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;

<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
    <B>Objective<BR>
    </B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>

<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;

&nbsp;

    <B>Met or<BR>
    </B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
<DIV style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; width: 1%; padding-bottom: 1px">
    <B>2009 Objective</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>Exceeded</B>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
<DIV style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; width: 1%; padding-bottom: 1px">
    <B>2009 Result</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Manage liquidity during market uncertainty
    to:&#160;(i)&#160;enhance cash flow and working capital
    management and reduce costs across Agrium; and (ii)&#160;enhance
    cash management forecasting accuracy.
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top">
    Yes
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Improved process for cash management and forecasting.
    Implemented a short-term liquidity forecasting mechanism in each
    of our business units.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Medium-term Liquidity Forecasting&#160;&#151; our monthly
    financial planning and forecasting processes have been expanded
    to include a rolling working capital and liquidity forecast for
    a minimum of three months.  On a quarterly basis, we are
    forecasting liquidity and working capital by month for the
    remainder of the fiscal year.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Working Capital Management&#160;&#151; we have implemented a
    monthly senior leadership team monitoring of cash and working
    capital forecasting accuracy. Performance measures for each
    Strategic Business Unit include a monthly charge for working
    capital utilization.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -8pt; margin-left: 8pt">
    Implementation of Agrium&#146;s succession plan.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top">
    Yes
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Agrium&#146;s succession plan was reviewed with the Board in
    2009 and is progressing according to plan.  Three officers have
    taken on new roles and responsibilities in the first half of
    2009, and all individuals have taken very well to their new
    positions. Took advantage of market opportunities to hire
    several key senior employees into the organization.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">

</TD>

</TD>

    stretch targets (for 80% of our measures).

    go/no-go decision on second and third production trains.

</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top">
    Yes
</TD>

    final stages of lender approval. The new structure has had a
    very positive impact on Agrium&#146;s balance sheet.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top">
    Yes
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Generated excellent returns in Q1 and Q2, and ultimately ended
    2009 with the third highest earnings in company history, despite
    significant economic challenges. That being said, our earnings
    expectations established at the beginning of 2009 were not met.
</TD>

<TR style="font-size: 1pt">

    Yes
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;

    will prove out viability of additional in-market coaters using
    urea at full market price. Expansion of this new technology is
    being managed at the appropriate pace. Also added an additional
    20,000 MT of new low cost capacity at our Sylacauga facility.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">

    improvement).

</TD>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD colspan="3" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -8pt; margin-left: 8pt">
    <B>Bruce G. Waterman</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <IMG src="o59476o5947661.jpg" alt="(WATERMAN PHOTO)">
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<B>Biography</B>.&#160;&#160;Bruce G. Waterman joined Agrium as
Senior Vice President, Finance &#038; Chief Financial Officer,
in April of 2000.  In this role, Mr. Waterman is responsible for
Treasury, Tax, Investor Relations, Controllers, Information
Technology and Government Relations.  Mr. Waterman is a graduate
of Queen&#146;s University in Ontario where he earned his degree
in Commerce in 1973. He achieved his Chartered Accountant
designation in 1975.  Mr. Waterman brings more than
30&#160;years of financial and management experience to his role
at Agrium.  Prior to joining Agrium, Mr. Waterman served as Vice
President, Finance &#038; Chief Financial Officer of Talisman
Energy in Calgary.<BR>
<BR>
In addition to the achievement of the individual objectives set
out below, Mr. Waterman was the 2008 recipient of the
Canada&#146;s CFO of the
Year<FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">tm</SUP></FONT>

Award, sponsored by Financial Executives International Canada,
PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, and Caldwell Partners International.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Accomplishments included: (i) successfully arranging a U.S.$1.4
    billion bridge financing for the proposed acquisition of CF
    Industries at the beginning of 2009 in the middle of the worst
    financial liquidity crisis in decades; (ii) supported the
    negotiations of U.S.$1.05 billion project financing for MOPCO to
    allow for the tripling of production to 1,950,000 tonnes of
    urea, of which Agrium has a 26% interest; and (iii) finalized
    new financing arrangements for CMF in Europe to assure ongoing
    access to working capital through the financial crisis.
</TD>

    staff depth to support a growing organization with increasing
    complexity.

</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top">
    Yes
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Integrated IT infrastructure support across the company and
    formalized an IT Shared Service Delivery Model and IT Governance
    Oversight. Implemented a new consolidation system to shorten the
    monthly/quarterly/annual close process and expand time available
    for analytical review. Continued to develop corporate wide cross
    training and succession planning for financial and IT functional
    disciplines in conjunction with HR. Completed staff training and
    process reviews to ensure efficient tracking of International
    Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) impacts throughout 2010 to
    allow for adoption effective January 1, 2011. Implemented
    optical character recognition scanning technology to eliminate
    manual entry and paper based processes with reduction in staff
    and cost.
</TD>
</TR>

    <B>2009 Result</B>

<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Enhance risk management identification, evaluation, mitigation
    processes and related reporting to the Board.
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top">
    Yes
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Improved the risk identification and evaluation process by
    updating our risk evaluation matrix to better reflect our
    current risk appetite, involving additional layers of management
    in risk assessment sessions, and improving risk ranking
    consistency through education and training on our ranking
    methodology. Implemented enhanced management and Board reporting
    from the Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) system and developed
    new risk reporting template with more clearly defined categories
    and definitions. Commenced evaluation of integration of ERM
    system with Technical Services and EHS&#038;S risk management
    processes to optimize leverage of our ERM system.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">

<TD>
&nbsp;

<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Biography.</B>&#160;&#160;Richard L. Gearheard has served as
    Senior Vice President of Agrium and President of the Retail
    Business Unit since August 1996.  He has also worked in various
    capacities with other Agrium Retail companies such as Western
    Farm Service as Vice President, Northwest Region and Crop
    Production Services as Vice President and Chief Financial
    Officer.  In 1983, he participated in the formation of Crop
    Production Services through a leveraged buyout.  During his
    career, he has been involved with company-changing acquisitions
    including PureGro, Western Farm Service and Royster-Clark.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

    performance, including continued implementation of processes and

    incidents, and zero incidents resulting in a fatality.

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Note:</B>
</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The term EBIT refers to earnings
    before interest expense and income taxes. The Corporation
    believes that EBIT is useful supplemental information as it
    provides an indication of the results generated by the
    Company&#146;s main business activities prior to taking into
    consideration how those activities are financed or taxed. EBIT
    is a non-GAAP earnings measure that does not have standardized
    measures prescribed by GAAP, and therefore may not be comparable
    to similar measures presented by other publicly traded companies.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="text-indent: -8pt; margin-left: 8pt">
    <B>Ron A. Wilkinson</B>

<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <IMG src="o59476o5947664.jpg" alt="(WILKINSON PHOTO)">
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Biography.</B>&#160;&#160;Ron A. Wilkinson is Senior Vice
    President, Agrium and President of the Wholesale Business Unit.
    Mr. Wilkinson joined Agrium in 1996 through the acquisition of
    Viridian Inc.  and held positions with the organization
    including Vice President Operations and Technology, Director,
    Technical Services, General Manager of South American
    Operations, General Manager of Operations and Projects, Asia
    Pacific, and Manager of Transportation.  Mr. Wilkinson has also
    worked for Sherritt Inc., Imperial Oil, Exxon Chemical Pakistan
    Limited and Esso Chemical Canada.  Mr. Wilkinson has over thirty
    years engineering, operations and business management experience
    within the petrochemical industry. A graduate of the University
    of Alberta with a B.Sc.  in Chemical Engineering, Mr. Wilkinson
    also completed &#147;The Executive Program&#148; at the
    University of Virginia, Darden School of Business in 1993.  He
    is a member of The Association of Professional Engineers,
    Geologists and Geophysicists of Alberta (APEGGA).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TD>
&nbsp;

<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
<DIV style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; width: 1%; padding-bottom: 1px">
    <B>2009 Result</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Increase shareholder value through strong profitability (EBIT)
    results for 2009.
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top">
    No
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    2009 Wholesale EBIT was $495 million.  Although well below the
    business plan it was the third best result in the last ten years.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Continued improvement of base business&#160;&#151; improve the
    Wholesale Business Unit&#146;s working capital forecasting
    process, increase reliability of manufacturing facilities and
    implement improved controls and reporting for purchase for
    resale positions.
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top">
    Yes
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Wholesale working capital forecasting system implemented with
    ongoing stewardship of working capital forecasts.  Average
    working capital for 2009 was well below budget levels. Average
    reliability for manufacturing facilities was improved 1.6% over
    2008. Position limits for purchase for resale were implemented
    for North America, Europe and Argentina in the first quarter,
    with monthly compliance monitoring.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Continuous improvement of the Wholesale Business Unit&#146;s
    safety performance.
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top">
    Yes
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Employee lost time and recordable injury indexes were at best
    ever levels and significantly improved from the previous record
    lows set in 2008.  The environmental incident index was equal to
    2008 performance however the severity of incidents was reduced.
    Average EHS&#038;S management system compliance audit scores for
    priority locations were improved over 2008.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Pursue and manage Wholesale Business Unit growth initiatives,
    including implementation, acquisition and existing facility
    expansion initiatives.
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top">
    Yes
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Agrium vigorously pursued the acquisition of CF Industries in
    2009.  In Egypt Agrium acquired a 26% ownership interest in
    MOPCO, with $20  million of equity earnings booked in 2009.
    Financial close was obtained for funding required for two
    additional ammonia/urea trains and construction was started.
    Further engineering progress was made on a project to add
    750,000 tonnes of annual potash capacity with the process design
    specification completed. Development of a greenfield potash mine
    was progressed, however the decision in early 2010 was taken to
    suspend further development.  Agrium retains significant potash
    reserves for potential greenfield mines in Saskatchewan and
    Manitoba.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Continue to improve the Wholesale Business Unit&#146;s culture
    and ability to attract and retain talented employees.
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="top">
    Yes
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Wholesale successfully launched its Growing Together initiative
    with very favourable employee feedback. Voluntary turnover for
    critical positions was reduced to less than 3% versus 6% in
    2008.  There was a significant improvement in average scores in
    the 2009&#160;employee survey versus scores achieved in 2006.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD colspan="3" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -8pt; margin-left: 8pt">
    <B>Leslie O&#146;Donoghue</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <IMG src="o59476o5947663.jpg" alt="(DONOGHUE PHOTO)">
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Biography.</B> Leslie O&#146;Donoghue has been employed at
    Agrium since 1999 and currently holds the position of Chief
    Legal Officer &#038; Senior Vice President, Business
    Development. Ms. O&#146;Donoghue&#146;s responsibilities include
    corporate strategy and business development, mergers and
    acquisitions, legal affairs, corporate governance, internal
    audit, and environmental, health, safety &#038; security.  Prior
    to joining Agrium, Ms. O&#146;Donoghue was a partner at Blake,
    Cassels &#038; Graydon LLP.  After earning her Economics degree
    from the University of Calgary in 1984, Ms. O&#146;Donoghue
    completed her LL.B.  at Queen&#146;s University in 1988, and was
    admitted to the Alberta Bar in 1989.<BR>
    <BR>
    In addition to the achievement of the individual objectives set
    out below, Ms.&#160;O&#146;Donoghue was recognized as the
    Canadian Dealmaker of the Year at the 2009 General Counsel
    Awards in connection with the UAP transaction, and was named in
    the Women&#146;s Executive Network&#146;s Most Powerful Women in
    Canada list.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <I><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Setting
    2009 NEO Compensation</FONT></U></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table sets out the basis for compensation
    decisions with respect to each element of NEO compensation in
    2009:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <TD width="20%">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>         <!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->

<TD colspan="18" align="center" valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Base Salary<BR>
    <BR>
    </B>See <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">the &#147;Summary<BR>
    Compensation Table&#148;<BR>
    (below) for the<BR>
    total base salary<BR>
    paid to each NEO<BR>
    during fiscal 2009,<BR>
    2008, and 2007.
    </FONT>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" colspan="15">
    As discussed above, base salary adjustments may be the result of
    (i) competitive salary adjustments (&#147;<B>Competitive
    Adjustment</B>&#148;) where needed to ensure that salary levels
    remain competitive on the basis of peer group market data (being
    the U.S. Peer Group or Mixed Peer Group, as applicable), (ii)
    merit increases (&#147;<B>Merit Increase</B>&#148;) where needed
    to reward superior performance (NEO goals and performance in
    2009 are set out under &#147;NEO Performance Objectives&#148;
    (above)), and (iii) promotional increases
    (&#147;<B>Responsibility Increase</B>&#148;) in circumstances
    where an officer has been promoted to a position of increased
    responsibility and/or has taken on increased responsibility in
    his or her existing role.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">

<TD></TD>
<TD colspan="15" valign="top" style="border-left: 0px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
<DIV style="text-indent: -19pt; margin-left: 19pt">
    (1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Base salary is set for the period
    commencing March 1 of each year, following the completion of
    performance reviews. &#147;2008 Base Pay&#148; reflects the
    amount paid to NEOs from March&#160;1, 2008 to February&#160;28,
    2009. &#147;2009 Base Pay&#148; reflects the amount paid to NEOs
    from March&#160;1, 2009 to February&#160;28, 2010.<BR>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD colspan="15" valign="top" style="border-left: 0px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
<DIV style="text-indent: -19pt; margin-left: 19pt">
    (2)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;The % increase is based on 2008 and
    2009 Base Pay excluding conversions related to foreign exchange
    rates.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD colspan="15" valign="top" style="border-left: 0px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
<DIV style="text-indent: -19pt; margin-left: 19pt">
    (3)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Ms.&#160;O&#146;Donoghue received a
    merit increase and competitive adjustment in March 2009 as a
    result of a Responsibility Increase.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 5pt">
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD colspan="15" style="border-left: 0px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD colspan="15" valign="top" style="border-left: 0px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 10pt">2010 Base
    Salary.</FONT></B><FONT style="font-size: 10pt">&#160;&#160;The
    HR&#038;C Committee decided not to make any adjustments to
    NEOs&#146; base salaries for 2009. However, results from a
    recent market analysis suggested moderate base pay adjustments
    are warranted and as a result the CEO&#146;s salary has been
    increased 6.3% and the other NEO&#146;s salaries have been
    increased an average of 3.25% for 2010.
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD colspan="15" valign="top" style="border-left: 0px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
<DIV style="text-indent: -19pt; margin-left: 19pt">
    (1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Base salary is set for the period
    commencing March 1 of each year, following the completion of
    performance reviews. &#147;2009 Base Pay&#148; reflects the
    amount paid to NEOs from March&#160;1, 2009 to February&#160;28,
    2010. &#147;2010 Base Pay&#148; reflects the amount paid to NEOs
    from March&#160;1, 2010 to February&#160;28, 2011. Base pay for
    2009 and 2010 has been converted from Cdn.$ to U.S.$ using the
    2009 average annual exchange rate of U.S.$1.00 = Cdn.$1.142.<BR>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD colspan="15" valign="top" style="border-left: 0px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
<DIV style="text-indent: -19pt; margin-left: 19pt">
    (2)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;The % increase is based on 2008 and
    2009 Base Pay excluding conversions related to foreign exchange
    rates. <DIV style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>





<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000" colspan="18">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="font-size: 10pt">
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD colspan="18" align="center" valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>Perks, Benefits, &#038; Pension<BR>
    <BR>
    </B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">See the &#147;Summary
    Compensation Table&#148; (below) for the dollar value of perks
    and benefits received and pension benefits accrued by each NEO
    in fiscal 2009, 2008, and 2007.<BR>
    </FONT></TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" colspan="15" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">    No changes to the standard NEO perks, benefits or retirement
    plans (as described under the section entitled
    &#147;Compensation Program Design&#148; (above)) were made in
    2009.</TD>

    Compensation Table&#148; (below) for the total annual incentives

</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    As discussed above, payouts under the Profit Sharing Plan are
    based on achievement of EBITDA targets and can range from zero
    (if EBITDA is below the Threshold level) to 10% of base salary
    (if EBITDA meets or exceeds the Maximum level). In 2009,
    consolidated EBITDA was $823 million which resulted in a zero
    payout under the Profit Sharing Plan for eligible corporate
    employees (including NEOs not in Wholesale), and a 4% payout for
    Wholesale employees (including Ron Wilkinson).  Profit Sharing
    Plan payments to NEOs were awarded as follows:

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="16%">&nbsp;</TD>         <!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>  <!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>  <!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="81%">&nbsp;</TD>         <!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<!-- TableOutputHead -->
<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Performance Recognition Plan<BR>
    <BR>
    </B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">See the &#147;Summary
    Compensation Table&#148; (below) for the total annual incentives
    paid to each NEO during fiscal 2009, 2008, and 2007.
    </FONT>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
As discussed above, payouts to eligible employees under the Performance Recognition Plan are
based on the achievement of corporate, business unit and individual objectives, as applicable.
Payments can range from zero (if corporate, business unit and individual performance are
below Threshold level) to double the target percentage of base salary (if corporate,
business unit and individual performance meet or exceed Maximum level).<BR><BR>The formula
used to calculate the Performance Recognition Plan payments to each NEO is as follows:<BR>
<BR><IMG src="o59476o5947674.gif" alt="(IMAGE)"></DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 2pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 16%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 7pt">Notes:</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -19pt; margin-left: 19pt">
    <FONT style="font-size: 7pt">(1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Target
    level compensation (near the median of the applicable peer
    group) would result from achievement of the target level
    performance objectives and would equal between 60% and 95% of
    each NEO&#146;s base salary.
    </FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -19pt; margin-left: 19pt">
    <FONT style="font-size: 7pt">(2)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Evaluation
    of corporate performance is based on achievement of specific
    corporate KPIs (see &#147;Corporate Performance Objectives&#148;
    (above) for the 2009 KPIs and actual 2009 achievement).
    Achievement of target level objectives would result in the
    target weight of 75% on corporate KPIs for the CEO and 50% on
    corporate KPIs for the other NEOs. The actual weight attributed
    to corporate KPIs (or &#147;<B>Corporate KPI Score</B>&#148;)
    can range from zero (if all corporate KPIs are below Threshold)
    to 150% for the CEO or 100% for the other NEOs (if Maximum level
    corporate KPIs are achieved).
    </FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -19pt; margin-left: 19pt">
    <FONT style="font-size: 7pt">(3)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Achievement
    of target level&#160;Business Unit objectives would result in
    the target weight of 25% on Business Unit performance for the
    NEOs other than the CEO. The actual weight attributed to
    Business Unit performance (or &#147;<B>Business Unit
    Score</B>&#148;) can range from zero to 50% depending upon
    performance.
    </FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -19pt; margin-left: 19pt">
    <FONT style="font-size: 7pt">(4)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Evaluation
    of individual performance is based on achievement of individual
    goals (see &#147;NEO Performance Objectives&#148; (above) for
    the NEOs&#146; 2009 goals and achievements). Achievement of
    target level performance would result in the target weight of
    25% on individual performance. The actual weight attributed to
    individual performance (the &#147;<B>Individual Performance
    Score</B>&#148;) can range from zero (for poor individual
    performance) to 50% (for excellent individual performance).<BR><BR style="font-size: 1pt">
    </FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD colspan="4" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    58
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 90%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->
<!-- XBRL Table Pagebreak -->

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Stock Options, SARs&#160;&#038; PSUs<BR>
    <BR>
    </B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">See the &#147;Summary
    Compensation Table&#148; (below) for the grant date fair value
    of all share-based and option-based awards granted to each NEO
    during fiscal 2009, 2008, and 2007.<BR>
    </FONT>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<FONT style="font-size: 8pt">As discussed above, the aggregate value of each NEO&#146;s long-term incentive award is determined by the HR&#038;C Committee on the basis of an assessment of (i) each NEO&#146;s position and responsibilities, where larger awards are granted to executives in positions with higher levels of responsibility for Agrium&#146;s long-term performance; (ii) each NEO&#146;s performance and level of sustained contribution to the Corporation; (iii) each NEO&#146;s long-term potential with the Corporation; and (iv) competitive practices with respect to the grant of long-term incentives by the applicable peer group, with total target level awards approximately aligned with the 50th&#160;percentile of the applicable peer group.<BR><BR><B>2009 Grants</B>.  In 2009, the Board and HR&#038;C Committee determined that a 50%/50% mix of stock options/SARs and PSUs be granted to provide a balanced focus on share price growth and Total Shareholder Return. </FONT></DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

    calculated in accordance with the expected life binomial lattice
    methodology using the<BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Common Share price on the date of grant
    of U.S.$40.30 and an expected value of 86%.

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD colspan="13" valign="bottom" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 4pt">
    <FONT style="font-size: 10pt">The grant date fair value of the
    PSUs has been determined by using the closing price of the
    Common Shares on the day preceding the grant. PSUs granted in
    January 2009 vest at the end of a three-year performance cycle
    beginning on January&#160;1, 2009 and ending on
    December&#160;31, 2011. The number of units that vest will
    depend on the relative ranking of the Corporation&#146;s Total
    Shareholder Return over the three-year performance cycle
    compared to the Total Shareholder Return over the same period
    for the PSU Peer Group. See <B>Schedule &#147;E&#148; </B>for a
    comprehensive description of the PSU Plan.
    </FONT>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 100%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<A name='157'>
<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Performance
    Graphs: Relationship between Corporate Performance and Executive
    Compensation</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table compares the cumulative five year return on
    our Common Shares (assuming $100 invested on December&#160;31,
    2004 and reinvestment of dividends) with the S&#038;P/TSX
    Composite Index:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 17pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <IMG src="o59476o5947675.gif" alt="(PERFORMANCE GRAPH)">
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Agrium&#146;s stock price appreciation over the past five years
    has exceeded the S&#038;P/TSX Composite Index (as illustrated
    above) with the exception of 2008, despite Agrium&#146;s record
    earnings that year. Our stock price slightly underperformed in
    2008, along with those of many of the Corporation&#146;s peers
    and the broader global equity markets, as market sentiments
    turned rapidly against commodities when economic uncertainty in
    the U.S.&#160;and elsewhere spurred fears of an impending global
    economic recession. In the medium to long-term, NEO compensation
    is directly impacted by stock price, as a large proportion of
    Agrium&#146;s executive compensation is awarded in stock
    options, SARs and PSUs with the expectation that these awards
    will increase or decrease in value as the Common Share price
    moves over time. NEO compensation has been directly impacted by
    the decline in the Corporation&#146;s stock price during 2008,
    through the corresponding decline in the value of NEOs&#146;
    previously awarded long-term incentives (being outstanding stock
    options and SARs and unvested PSUs). Through 2009, Agrium&#146;s
    stock price has increased significantly resulting in an increase
    in the value of NEO&#146;s previously awarded long-term
    incentives.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    60
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table shows the trend (based on the percentage
    change since 2004)&#160;in Agrium&#146;s EBITDA and Sales over
    the last five fiscal years:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <IMG src="o59476o5947676.gif" alt="(PERFORMANCE GRAPH)">
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Although the general trend in Agrium&#146;s Common Share price
    over the past five years has been favourable, given recent
    market events Agrium believes that the trend in share price is
    not the only meaningful basis on which to measure total NEO
    compensation awarded. As discussed above, Agrium is committed to
    a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">&#147;pay-for-performance&#148;</FONT>
    philosophy that defines the relationship between compensation,
    business performance and the creation of sustainable Shareholder
    value. The total annual compensation paid to NEOs is
    meaningfully linked to EBITDA and Sales and other KPIs (as
    discussed under &#147;Basis for Compensation
    Decisions&#160;&#150; Determining Actual
    Compensation&#160;&#150; Corporate Performance Objectives&#148;
    (above)) as the amount of compensation awarded to NEOs by the
    Board is directly impacted by Agrium&#146;s performance in these
    measures. As shown above for the period from 2004 to 2009,
    Agrium&#146;s EBITDA and Sales performance have been trending in
    a positive direction through to 2008, with 2009 being the only
    exception as a result of the industry&#146;s reaction to the
    downturn in the economy. The trend in total NEO cash
    compensation has generally followed the trend in EBITDA and
    Sales.
</DIV>

<A name='158'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Cost of
    Management</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The cost of management ratio expresses the total of all types of
    compensation paid or awarded to the NEOs (including the CEO) as
    disclosed in the three-year Summary Compensation Table (defined
    below), as a percentage of net income and of market
    capitalization of the Corporation:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<A name='159'>
<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">CEO
    Look-back/Look-forward Total Take Analysis</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Prior to making 2010 compensation decisions, a thorough
    look-back and look-forward total take analysis for CEO
    compensation was conducted by the compensation consultant for
    the HR&#038;C Committee. This involved reviewing a comparison of
    compensation earned over the CEO&#146;s tenure to performance
    achieved during that period (look-back). As well, stress-testing
    of compensation programs was conducted under various performance
    scenarios to understand how the programs will react to future
    external and internal events to ensure that there will be an
    ongoing link between compensation and business performance and
    that the appropriate amount of risk and leverage are built into
    the programs (look-forward). This analysis was reviewed and
    discussed in conjunction with the decisions made with respect to
    recommendations for CEO compensation for 2010. Ensuring Agrium
    maintains a strong link between compensation and performance was
    a key objective of this exercise.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    62
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='160'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Promoting
    and Protecting Agrium&#146;s Interests</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Board and our management have established a tone at the top
    for our organization that is based on uncompromising integrity
    and ethical standards. Every executive is held accountable to
    comply with Agrium&#146;s high ethical standards and the Board
    has adopted the following policies and practices to protect
    Agrium&#146;s interests and to align executive&#146;s interests
    with those of the Shareholders:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="17%">&nbsp;</TD>         <!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%" nowrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>  <!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>  <!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="76%">&nbsp;</TD>         <!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>  <!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>    <!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>    <!-- colindex=03 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>     <!-- colindex=03 type=hang1 -->

<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;

<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">

<TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Mandatory<BR>
    Share<BR>
    Ownership</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="5" valign="top">
    The Corporation has equity ownership guidelines applicable to
    the NEOs and other senior executives. The equity ownership
    guidelines are intended to support the ongoing alignment of the
    interests of the Corporation&#146;s senior executives with
    Shareholders through long-term ownership of Common Shares. The
    guidelines were revised on February 25, 2009 to require that at
    least 50% of the ownership requirement be satisfied by ownership
    of Common Shares.  The remainder of the equity ownership
    requirement can be satisfied by ownership of Common Shares
    and/or PSUs. Prior to the date of the revision, officers were
    not required to hold a specific number of Common Shares and the
    equity ownership guidelines could be satisfied solely through
    the ownership of PSUs. Officers will be given five years from
    the date of the revision to satisfy the new Common Share
    ownership requirement. The guidelines applicable to the senior
    executives are as follows:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <BR>
    63

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 9pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="17%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="77%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=hang1 -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<!-- TableOutputHead -->
<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Reimbursement<BR>
    of Compensation</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="5" valign="top">
    The Corporation has an executive compensation clawback policy
    concerning future awards made under the Corporation&#146;s
    annual and long-term incentive plans which permits the Board to
    require executive officers to reimburse all or a portion of such
    incentive compensation in certain situations where the Board
    determines it is in the Corporation&#146;s best interest.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 10pt">Prohibition on<BR>
    Hedging and<BR>
    Equity<BR>
    Monetization</FONT></B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="5" valign="top">
    The Corporation grants equity compensation to its officers and
    directors and has equity ownership guidelines for officer and
    directors in order to align the interests of officers and
    directors with those of Shareholders.  The Corporation does not
    allow officers or directors to enter into any derivative
    transaction on Agrium securities, including any type of hedging
    or monetization practice, which may reduce the risk of equity
    ownership and negate the alignment of interests created by
    equity ownership.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<B><FONT style="font-size: 10pt">Code of<BR>Business<BR>Conduct and Ethics<BR><BR></FONT></B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The Code is<BR>available at<BR>www.agrium.com<BR>under &#147;Corporate<BR>Governance&#148;</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="5" valign="top">
    Agrium is committed to maintaining the highest standard of legal
    and ethical conduct in all of its activities.  Agrium&#146;s
    directors, officers and other employees are required to comply
    with the Code of Business Conduct and Ethics (the
    &#147;<B>Code</B>&#148;), which sets out their commitment to (i)
    comply with all applicable laws, (ii) act in the best interest
    of the Corporation, (iii) treat customers, suppliers and others
    fairly and honestly, (iv) provide a safe, orderly and tolerant
    work environment and act with respect, cooperation and dignity
    toward fellow employees, (v) serve the interests of our
    shareholders with integrity and loyalty, (vi) ensure our work is
    sensitive to the Corporation&#146;s commitment to the
    environmental stewardship, and (vii) report violations of law or
    policies through appropriate channels.  NEOs annually certify
    compliance with the Code which is monitored by the Board and the
    CG&#038;N Committee.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="5" valign="top">
    Among other things, the Code prohibits all directors, officers
    and other employees with knowledge of material non-public
    information from buying, selling or otherwise trading in the
    Corporation&#146;s securities or from conveying material
    non-public information to other persons who may use it for
    trading purposes.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="5" valign="top">
    See <B>Schedule &#147;B&#148; </B>for more information regarding
    the Code.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Securities Trading<BR>
    and Reporting<BR>
    Policy</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="5" valign="top">
    Agrium has a securities trading and reporting policy (the
    &#147;<B>Trading Policy</B>&#148;) which safeguards against
    insider trading and protects employees from allegations of
    insider trading by:
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="5" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -21pt; margin-left: 21pt">
    (i)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;mandating the
    confidential treatment of non-public corporate information,
    including restrictions on access to and transmission of such
    information,
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The Trading Policy<BR>
    is available at<BR>
    www.agrium.com<BR>
    under &#147;Corporate<BR>
    Governance&#148;
    </FONT>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="5" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -27pt; margin-left: 27pt">
    (ii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;restricting the
    trading activities of directors, officers and other employees
    who may know, or be presumed to know, of material non-public
    information, including requiring all restricted persons to
    pre-clear trades in Agrium securities with Agrium&#146;s Legal
    Department and imposing standard blackout periods corresponding
    to the preparation of the Corporation&#146;s financial
    statements during which trading in Agrium&#146;s securities is
    prohibited, and
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="5" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -34pt; margin-left: 34pt">
    (iii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;requiring
    directors, officers and other employees to notify the
    Corporation&#146;s Legal Department of details of any trades
    once completed.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Option Granting<BR>
    Policy</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="5" valign="top">
    On February 24, 2009, the HR&#038;C Committee adopted the Option
    Granting Policy to document the Corporation&#146;s existing
    practices and promote consistent and efficient administration of
    stock options and SARs, including (i) the procedure for annual
    grants, (ii) the procedure for one-off grants under the
    President&#146;s Award Program, (iii) meticulous record keeping,
    and (iv) the postponement of grants if non-public material
    information exists at the time of any proposed grant.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Corporate Governance</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="5" valign="top">
    The Board and management are committed to corporate governance
    and have been consistently recognized for excellence in this
    respect. Our corporate governance systems and principles of
    conduct have been engrained into our business operations and
    culture and will continue to play an important role in promoting
    appropriate oversight and consistent governance practices
    throughout our organization. See &#147;Section Three: Corporate
    Governance&#148; for a detailed description of our corporate
    governance practices.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
