<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    64
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='161'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Conclusion</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Despite continuing challenges in the industry and the economy in
    general, the Corporation continues to be financially strong and
    focused on growing our business in a manner that is intended to
    add the most value for our shareholders. With all things
    considered, the Corporation, our employees and our senior
    executives have performed well in following through on our
    corporate strategy and delivering strong results on individual
    goals through a period of continued transformational growth and
    business integration, and during an extended period of economic
    uncertainty and customer restraint. As a result of the
    challenges in the economy, including our industry, not all of
    our annual financial goals were achieved. This is reflected in
    annual incentive payouts. Our employees and senior executives
    (including the NEOs) have been fairly compensated for this
    performance by appropriate payouts under our annual incentive
    and long-term equity plans.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The HR&#038;C Committee is confident in the design of the
    Corporation&#146;s compensation program and believes that the
    program continues to fulfill the Corporation&#146;s compensation
    objectives, such that it will continue to motivate senior
    executives to achieve desired results, without encouraging
    unduly risky behaviour.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The HR&#038;C Committee reviewed and discussed, and recommended
    to the Board for approval, the compensation disclosure contained
    in the Circular, including the CD&#038;A and the information
    contained under the headings &#147;2009&#160;Director
    Compensation: Tables and Narrative&#148; and &#147;2009
    Executive Compensation: Tables and Narrative&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<A name='163'>
<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Summary
    Compensation Table</FONT></B>

    earned by the CEO and CFO of the Corporation, as well as the
    three other most highly compensated executive officers
    (collectively, the &#147;<B>NEOs</B>&#148;), for services
    rendered in all capacities during 2009, 2008 and 2007. Specific
    aspects of this compensation are dealt with in further detail in
    the following tables:

    <BR>
    65

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Notes:</B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Amounts reported represent the base
    salary amount paid to NEOs in 2009, 2008 and 2007.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Amounts reported represent the
    grant date fair value of PSUs awarded in 2009, 2008 and 2007.
    Grant date fair value has been calculated in accordance with
    expected life binomial lattice methodology using Agrium&#146;s
    share price on the date of grant of U.S. $40.30, U.S.$74.07 and
    U.S.$39.73 in 2009, 2008 and 2007, respectively. For grants made
    in 2009, the key valuation assumptions used were stock price
    volatility of 25.7%, dividend yield of 0.2%, and full
    3&#160;year term, resulting in an expected value of 86%. For
    grants made in 2008, the key valuation assumptions used were
    stock price volatility of 25.7%, dividend yield of 0.2%, and
    full 3&#160;year term, resulting in an expected value of 86% of
    the grant date value. For grants made in 2007, the key valuation
    assumptions used were stock price volatility of 24.2%, dividend
    yield of 0.5%, and full 3&#160;year term, resulting in an
    expected value of 86% of the grant date value. The expected life
    binomial lattice methodology is used to ensure consistent
    long-term incentive valuation across competitive market data.
    See &#147;Incentive Plan Awards&#160;&#151; Outstanding
    Share-based Awards and Option-based Awards&#148; for the value
    of outstanding PSU awards at December&#160;31, 2009. The
    accounting liability recorded is based on the average Common
    Share price on the NYSE as at the close of the last five trading
    days before the balance sheet date. As of the grant date, there
    is zero recorded accounting liability. Vested share-based awards
    are accounted for as liabilities based on the intrinsic value,
    calculated as the difference between the market value of the
    underlying stock and the exercise price of the award.
    Compensation expense is recorded, on a straight-line basis, over
    the vesting period of the award. The number of PSUs that vest
    depends on the relative ranking of the Corporation&#146;s Total
    Shareholder Return over the three-year performance cycle
    compared to the Total Shareholder Return over the same period
    for the PSU Peer Group. 100% of the PSUs vest if the
    Corporation&#146;s Total Shareholder Return is equal to the
    median of the peer group. Vesting ranges between 50% for
    performance at or below the 25th percentile and up to 150% for
    performance at or above the 75th percentile. Fluctuations in the
    market value of the underlying stock subsequent to the date of
    grant, determined based on the closing price of the stock on the
    last day of each reporting period and changes in other vesting
    assumptions will result in a change to the related liability and
    the compensation expense which is recognized in the period in
    which the fluctuation occurs. If an employee is eligible to
    retire during the vesting period, the Corporation recognizes
    compensation expense over the period from the date of grant to
    the retirement eligibility date on a straight-line basis. If an
    employee is eligible to retire on the date of the grant,
    compensation expense is recognized on the grant date.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(3)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Amounts reported represent the
    grant date fair value of stock options, tandem SARs and
    stand-alone SARs awarded in 2009, 2008 and 2007. Grant date fair
    value has been calculated in accordance with expected life
    binomial lattice methodology using Agrium&#146;s share price on
    the date of grant of U.S.$40.30, U.S.$74.07 and U.S.$39.73 in
    2009, 2008 and 2007, respectively. For grants made in 2009, the
    key valuation assumptions used were stock price volatility of
    25.7%, dividend yield of 0.2%, and expected life of
    6.25&#160;years, resulting in an expected value of 33% of the
    grant date value. For grants made in 2008, the key valuation
    assumptions used were stock price volatility of 25.7%, dividend
    yield of 0.2% and expected life of 6.25&#160;years, resulting in
    an expected value of 33% of the grant date value. For grants
    made in 2007, the key valuation assumptions used were stock
    price volatility of 24.2%, dividend yield of 0.5%, and expected
    life of 6.25&#160;years, resulting in an expected value of 31%
    of the grant date value. The expected life binomial lattice
    methodology is used to ensure consistent long-term incentive
    valuation across competitive market data. See &#147;Incentive
    Plan Awards&#160;&#151; Outstanding Share-based Awards and
    Option-based Awards&#148; for the value of outstanding
    option-based awards at December&#160;31, 2009. The accounting
    liability recorded is based on the excess of the U.S. dollar
    equivalent of the highest price of the Common Shares on the NYSE
    on the balance sheet date over the exercise price. As of the
    grant date, there is zero recorded accounting liability. Vested
    option-based awards are accounted for as liabilities based on
    the intrinsic value, calculated as the difference between the
    market value of the underlying stock and the exercise price of
    the award. Compensation expense is recorded on a straight-line
    basis over the vesting period of the award. Fluctuations in the
    market value of the underlying stock subsequent to the date of
    grant, determined based on the closing price of the stock on the
    last day of each reporting period, and changes in other vesting
    assumptions will result in a change to the related liability and
    the compensation expense, which is recognized in the period in
    which the fluctuation occurs. If an employee is eligible to
    retire during the vesting period, the Corporation recognizes
    compensation expense over the period from the date of grant to
    the retirement eligibility date on a straight-line basis. If an
    employee is eligible to retire on the date of the grant
    compensation expense is recognized on the grant date.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(4)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">As discussed in notes (2)&#160;and
    (3)&#160;above, the option-based award and share-based award
    amounts reported in the Summary Compensation Table represent the
    grant date fair value of equity grants in 2009, 2008 and 2007. A
    comparison between grant date fair value and the current or
    actual value of option-based awards (being options and SARs) and
    share-based awards (being PSUs) is as follows:
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

    made in March of 2010, 2009 and 2008 under the Profit Sharing
    Plan and Performance Recognition Plan that were awarded for NEO
    performance in 2009, 2008 and 2007, respectively.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(6)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Amounts reported include all
    compensation related to Agrium&#146;s defined benefit and
    defined contribution plans, including service costs, plan
    changes and above market earnings.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(7)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Amounts reported represent all
    perquisites, life insurance premiums and amounts in substitution
    of vacation paid by the Corporation.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(8)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The conversion rate used was
    U.S.$1.00 = Cdn.$1.1420, $1.0660 and $1.0748 for each of
    December&#160;31, 2009, 2008 and 2007, respectively, with the
    exception of the amounts applicable to Mr.&#160;Gearheard to
    which no conversion rate was applied as he is paid in U.S.
    dollars.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='164'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Incentive
    Plan Awards</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Outstanding
    share-based awards and option-based awards</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table provides details regarding outstanding
    option and share-based awards as at December&#160;31, 2009:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="19%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="10%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="2%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=lead -->
    <TD width="2%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=body -->

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV style="font-size: 0pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Notes:</B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Vesting of options and SARs is
    determined by the Board at the time of grant; although,
    generally, options and SARs vest in 25% increments over four
    years.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Where applicable, unexercised
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">in-the-money</FONT>
    option values have been converted from Cdn.$ to U.S.$ using the
    exchange rate on December&#160;31, 2009 of U.S.$1.00 =
    Cdn.$1.0466.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(3)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Includes units credited as
    reinvested dividends.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(4)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Market payout value based on
    performance as at December&#160;31, 2009 and Common Share price.
    Based on the Corporation&#146;s performance through
    December&#160;31, 2009 relative to the PSU Peer Group, the 2008
    grant is tracking at 150% of the target grant level since the
    Corporation&#146;s performance is at approximately the
    83<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">rd</SUP>

    percentile, and the 2009 grant is tracking at 128% of the target
    grant level since the Corporation&#146;s performance is at
    approximately the
    64<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">th</SUP>

    percentile.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(5)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Target payout value based on target
    performance payout of 100%, valued according to the share price
    on December&#160;31, 2009 of U.S.$61.50. The number of vesting
    PSUs is determined on the basis of achievement of Total
    Shareholder Return performance goals, which could result in
    different payouts depending upon the actual achievement of
    threshold, target or maximum goals.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(6)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">These option awards were granted
    pursuant to the Corporation&#146;s &#147;One for One
    Program&#148; which was implemented in 1999 and discontinued in
    2004 pursuant to which executive officers who acquired Common
    Shares in the open market received matching options to acquire
    an additional Common Share for each such acquired share, up to a
    maximum limit of 100,000 options over a ten year period for each
    executive officer that chose to participate in the Program. The
    option exercise price in each case was equal to the price of the
    Common Shares purchased by the executive officer in the open
    market. Options granted under the Program were otherwise
    governed by the terms of the Stock Option Plan.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Incentive
    plan awards&#160;&#151; value vested during the
    year</FONT></I></B>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    69
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV style="font-size: 0pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Notes:</B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Shows the aggregated dollar value
    that would have been realized if all options and SARs vested in
    2009 were exercised on the vesting date. The number and value of
    options and SARs actually exercised by each NEO in the year are
    as follows: B.G. Waterman 109,200 ($4,255,414).
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Value vested during the year based
    on Agrium&#146;s stock price at close of day on
    December&#160;31, 2009 of U.S.$61.50 and a payout factor of 150%
    of target (including reinvested dividends).
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(3)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Shows the amount paid out in 2010,
    for PSUs granted in 2007, which payment was based on
    Agrium&#146;s average stock price from December 24 to
    December&#160;31, 2009 of U.S.$62.99.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(4)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Represents the total payments to
    each NEO under the Profit Sharing Plan and the Performance
    Recognition Plan.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Incentive
    plan awards&#160;&#151; value exercised during the
    year</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    awards exercised by the NEOs during the year ended
    December&#160;31, 2009:

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='165'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Pension
    Plan Benefits</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Corporation undertook a comprehensive review of North
    American market practice with respect to retirement programs in
    2005. As a result of the review, the Corporation introduced
    changes to the executive retirement program for designated
    executives (including the NEOs) in 2006. The new retirement
    programs are described below and reference is made to the prior
    programs where such programs were still applicable in 2009.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Under the current executive retirement program, designated
    executives participate in:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    defined contribution plans, which are subject to the maximum
    limits imposed under applicable income tax legislation, being
    either:
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="8%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the Registered Defined Contribution Plan (the &#147;<B>DC
    Plan</B>&#148;) for Canadian executives;&#160;or
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the qualified 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan (the
    &#147;<B>401(k) Plan</B>&#148;) for
    U.S.&#160;executives;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    defined benefit plans, which cover earnings in excess of the
    limits imposed under applicable income tax legislation, being
    either:
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="8%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the Canadian Defined Benefit Supplemental Executive Retirement
    Plan (the &#147;<B>Canadian DB SERP</B>&#148;) for designated
    Canadian executives;&#160;or
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the U.S.&#160;Defined Benefit Supplemental Executive Retirement
    Plan (the &#147;<B>U.S.&#160;DB SERP</B>&#148;) for designated
    U.S.&#160;executives.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In order to participate in the Canadian DB SERP or the
    U.S.&#160;DB SERP, as applicable, each designated executive
    entered into an agreement with the Corporation that
    (i)&#160;waived benefits under prior supplementary plans, and
    (ii)&#160;phased out by age&#160;60 (the normal retirement date
    under the Canadian DB SERP and the U.S.&#160;DB SERP) any
    severance benefits to which the executive would otherwise have
    been entitled.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Defined
    contribution plans</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    With the exception of Mr.&#160;Gearheard, the NEOs are members
    of the DC Plan. The DC Plan is registered under the <I>Income
    Tax Act </I>(Canada) and the <I>Employment Pension Plans Act
    </I>(Alberta) and is subject to the maximum pension and
    contribution limits imposed under the <I>Income Tax Act
    </I>(Canada). Under the DC Plan, the Corporation contributes 6%
    of eligible base salary, and if the participant makes voluntary
    contributions up to 6% of eligible base salary, the Corporation
    makes 50% matching contributions up to 3% of eligible base
    salary. For designated executives, eligible base salary is
    limited each year to the earnings level that generates the
    maximum annual contribution that can be made to the DC Plan in
    accordance with the <I>Income Tax Act </I>(Canada), which was
    $128,430 in 2009 (the &#147;<B>DC Plan Earnings Limit</B>&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Mr.&#160;Gearheard is a member of the 401(k) Plan. Prior to
    2008, the 401(k) Plan permitted voluntary contributions up to
    30% of total compensation, with such contributions subject to
    the U.S.&#160;legal maximum. The amount of the
    Corporation&#146;s contribution was 50% of the first 6% of
    employee contributions. Effective January&#160;1, 2008, the
    earnings used to determine the Corporation&#146;s contribution
    to the 401(k) Plan for Mr.&#160;Gearheard are limited to the DC
    Plan Earnings Limit, expressed in U.S.&#160;dollars at par.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Until January&#160;1, 2008, Mr.&#160;Gearheard was a member of
    the Agrium U.S.&#160;Inc. Retirement Plan (the
    &#147;<B>U.S.&#160;Basic Plan</B>&#148;), a non-contributory
    defined benefit retirement plan. The U.S.&#160;Basic Plan is
    qualified under the U.S.&#160;Internal Revenue Code. The formula
    for benefits on retirement under the U.S.&#160;Basic Plan is
    1.1% of three year average best earnings prior to January 2008
    (the &#147;<B>Final Average Earnings</B>&#148;) up to Social
    Security Average Wages plus 1.4% of Final Average Earnings in
    excess of Social Security Average Wages multiplied by the first
    35&#160;years of Benefit Service, plus 0.8% of the Final Average
    Earnings multiplied by the years of Benefit Service in excess of
    35&#160;years but less than 40&#160;years. Under the
    U.S.&#160;Basic Plan earnings are limited to those permitted
    under the Internal Revenue Code. As of January&#160;1, 2008,
    Mr.&#160;Gearheard retains his qualified U.S.&#160;Basic Plan
    benefit for his period of employment prior to January&#160;1,
    2008, but is no longer earning a benefit for future service.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    71
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The table below presents the benefits accumulated under
    Agrium&#146;s defined contribution plans. The actual benefits
    payable upon retirement will be determined by the size of each
    participant&#146;s account values (based on the amount of actual
    contribution and by the realized investment returns), interest
    rates at the time benefits commence and the type of retirement
    vehicle selected (life income fund, life annuity, joint annuity,
    etc.):
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Defined
    benefit plans</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    With the exception of Mr.&#160;Gearheard, the NEOs are members
    of the Canadian DB SERP. Mr.&#160;Gearheard is a member of the
    U.S.&#160;DB SERP which is substantially similar in all respects
    to the Canadian DB SERP.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Under the Canadian DB SERP and the U.S.&#160;DB SERP, designated
    executives receive a pension of 2% of the average of the three
    highest consecutive years of excess earnings (&#147;<B>Excess
    Earnings</B>&#148;) multiplied by years of service as a
    designated executive. Excess Earnings is equal to the sum of
    base salary above the DC Plan Earnings Limit plus the actual
    incentive paid in respect of the year (including incentives
    under the Profit Sharing Plan and the Performance Recognition
    Plan), up to a maximum of the executive&#146;s target incentive
    level for the year. Excess Earnings are capped at
    U.S.$0.9&#160;million ($1&#160;million in Canadian currency) for
    designated executives and U.S.$2.2&#160;million for the CEO.
    Although both the Canadian DB SERP and U.S.&#160;DB SERP permit
    the granting of extra years of credited service, it is
    Agrium&#146;s general practice not to credit executives with
    additional years of service. However, upon termination of an
    executive&#146;s employment without cause or constructive
    dismissal of an executive, he or she may be credited with
    additional year(s) of service pursuant to the terms of
    employment related agreements between the Corporation and
    executives. Please see &#147;NEO Contracts&#148; (below) for
    details of the executive employment agreements.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The overall amount of pension payable under the Canadian DB SERP
    and U.S.&#160;DB SERP is limited to 70% of final base salary.
    Normal retirement age is 60&#160;years. Early retirement
    benefits are available from age&#160;55 with the pension reduced
    by 6% for each year retirement precedes normal retirement age.
    Postponed retirement benefits are available after age&#160;60
    with the pension increased by 6% for each year of retirement
    that occurs after normal retirement age. The retirement pension
    is paid for life, with a spousal survivor pension of 60% of the
    executive&#146;s pension, or a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">15-year</FONT>
    guarantee for an executive without a spouse at retirement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Each of the NEOs were 50% vested under the Canadian DB SERP upon
    inception at June&#160;25, 2006. The remainder of their Canadian
    DB SERP entitlements vested at the rate of 25% over each of the
    following two years.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In addition to Canadian DB SERP amounts, pursuant to
    Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s employment contract, a commitment has
    been made to provide a minimum rate of return on assets
    transferred from the pension programs of Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s
    prior employer, which reflects an average return on a third
    party balanced investment fund in the five years preceding the
    commencement of Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s employment with the
    Corporation. See &#147;NEO Contracts&#148; (below) for details
    of Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s employment contract.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    For Mr.&#160;Gearheard&#146;s service before January&#160;1,
    2008, the determination of Excess Earnings under the
    U.S.&#160;DB SERP was modified to reflect the earnings limit
    applicable to the U.S.&#160;Basic Plan under the
    U.S.&#160;Internal Revenue Code, which was $225,000 in 2007.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    72
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Fourteen designated executives of the Corporation are
    participating in the unfunded Canadian DB SERP or the
    U.S.&#160;DB SERP. The total accrued pension obligation for the
    Canadian DB SERP and the U.S.&#160;DB SERP included in our
    December&#160;31, 2009 financial statements was $25,101,000. As
    these benefits are not pre-funded through a trust, benefits are
    paid from the general revenues of the Corporation. The Canadian
    DB SERP benefits for all Canadian participants who are not also
    U.S.&#160;taxpayers are secured by a Letter of Credit. The cost
    to secure the Letter of Credit was $191,000 in 2009.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The table below presents the projected annual retirement
    benefits (related to the defined benefit plan components of the
    retirement program) payable to NEOs at year end and upon normal
    retirement. In addition, the total defined benefit accrued
    pension obligation for each NEO is shown along with the changes
    to the obligation in 2009:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Notes:</B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">None of the NEOs have been credited
    with additional years of service above the years of service
    actually provided to the Corporation.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The normal retirement age for NEOs
    is 60. As discussed under &#147;Pension Benefits&#148; (above),
    in order to participate in the Canadian DB SERP or U.S. DB SERP,
    as applicable, designated executives entered into agreements
    with the Corporation phasing out any severance benefits by the
    age of 60.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(3)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The projected annual pension
    benefits are calculated assuming the highest average Excess
    Earnings remain unchanged from December&#160;31, 2009.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(4)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The accrued pension obligations are
    the actuarial value of projected benefits for service accrued to
    the date indicated. The calculation of the amounts shown in the
    table use actuarial assumptions and methods that are consistent
    with those used for calculating pension obligations disclosed in
    the Corporation&#146;s consolidated financial statements as of
    the date indicated. With the exception of amounts applicable to
    Mr.&#160;Gearheard, the conversion rate used was U.S.$1.00 =
    Cdn.$1.2246 and $1.0466 for December&#160;31, 2008 and
    December&#160;31, 2009 respectively.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(5)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The amount related to service cost
    and compensation changes differing from the assumptions (as
    utilized for purposes of calculating pension obligations as
    disclosed in the Corporation&#146;s consolidated financial
    statements).
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(6)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The amount related to items such as
    interest on the obligation, the impact of changes in the
    discount rate assumption and changes in the U.S. exchange rate
    for Canadian executives.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(7)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The accrued pension obligation
    disclosed for Mr.&#160;Wilson includes all components of his
    retirement program as described under &#147;NEO Contracts&#148;
    (below).
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

    <BR>

<DIV style="width: 90%; margin-left: 5%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='166'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NEO
    Contracts</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Agrium entered into an employment agreement with its CEO,
    Michael M. Wilson. The key terms of the employment agreement are
    as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 9pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Mr. Wilson is eligible to receive a base salary of not less than
    the 50<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">th</SUP>

    percentile of the salaries paid to chief executive officers of
    an identified U.S. peer group.  The identified U.S. peer group
    will be adjusted and updated at the discretion of the HR&#038;C
    Committee.  See &#147;2009 Compensation Discussion &#038;
    Analysis - Basis for Compensation Decisions - Peer Group&#148;
    for a discussion of the current U.S. Peer Group.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 12pt">
<TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>

    The Board retains the discretion to adjust Mr. Wilson&#146;s
    salary below the
    50<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">th</SUP>

    percentile of the U.S. Peer Group based on overall financial
    performance of the Corporation, provided that similar downward
    adjustments are made to the salaries of all senior officers of
    the Corporation.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

    Based Compensation<BR>
    Participation</B>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;
</TD>

    Mr. Wilson&#146;s employment agreement allows him to participate
    in:<BR>
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Annual
    Incentives.  The target level for Mr. Wilson&#146;s annual
    incentive shall be equal to the
    50<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">th</SUP>

    percentile of incentive bonuses paid to chief executive officers
    of the U.S. Peer Group. The<BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;actual
    bonus received by Mr. Wilson shall be determined in accordance
    with terms of applicable <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;incentive
    plans.
</TD>

<DIV style="text-indent: -4pt; margin-left: 4pt">
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Long-Term
    Incentives.  The target level for Mr. Wilson&#146;s long-term
    incentive compensation, including stock options and PSUs, shall
    be equal to the
    50<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">th</SUP>

    percentile of equity compensation paid to chief executive
    officers of the U.S. Peer Group.
</DIV>
</TD>

    Incentives.  Mr. Wilson may, at the Board&#146;s discretion, be
    entitled to participate in<BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;compensation
    plans or perks that are introduced from time to time for senior
    executives.

</TD>

    business mileage.

    annual physical examination, provided that such benefit shall
    not include any major treatment <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;with a

    return<BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;preparation.

<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;

    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;golf
    club membership and annual dues paid by the Corporation.

    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;any
    other perks extended to senior executives of the Corporation
    from time to time.
</DIV>
</TD>

<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">

    of 30,000 PSUs.

    Mr. Wilson is entitled to participate in the DC Plan and the
    Canadian DB SERP (as defined and disclosed above under
    &#147;Pension Plan Benefits&#148;). In addition, upon the
    termination of the employment agreement, Agrium agreed to
    provide a minimum rate of return on assets transferred from the
    pension programs of Mr.&#160;Wilson&#146;s prior employer, which
    reflects an average return on a third party balanced investment
    fund in the five years preceding the commencement of Mr.
    Wilson&#146;s employment with the Corporation.
</TD>

<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>Termination of<BR>
    Employment without<BR>
    Cause and<BR>
    Constructive<BR>
    Dismissal and<BR>
    Change of Control</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
In the event that Mr. Wilson: <BR><BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
(i)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;is terminated by the Corporation without cause,<BR><BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
(ii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;terminates his employment after the occurrence of an event of Constructive Dismissal<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">(1)</SUP>, or <BR>

</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -34pt; margin-left: 34pt;">
(iii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;is terminated or constructively dismissed for any reason other than disability, death or just<BR>cause within two years of a Change of Control<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">(2)</SUP> of the Corporation,

</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 9pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
Mr. Wilson would be entitled to receive a payment equal to his then monthly base salary multiplied by 36&#160;months; his target annual and long-term incentives for the current year prorated to the date of termination plus three times his target annual and long-term incentives for the current year; three times the annual cost of his perks; the cost of providing short and long-term disability and other health and welfare benefits that cannot be continued after the date of termination for a period of 36&#160;months, with the remainder of his health and welfare benefits being continued for a period of 36&#160;months; and credit for an additional three years of age and service for purposes of calculating his pension under the DC Plan and Canadian DB SERP or any other pension plan and supplemental plan in which he participates; provided that if Mr. Wilson&#146;s employment is terminated for any reason referred to in clauses (i), (ii) or (iii) above within three years of the expiry date of May 13, 2011, the Corpor
ation shall only be liable to pay a prorated amount based on the number of months remaining from the termination date to the expiry date of May 13, 2011.<BR><BR>In addition, Mr. Wilson would be entitled to:</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -4pt; margin-left: 4pt">
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;job
    relocation counselling services, tax and legal advice at a cost
    to the Corporation not to exceed<BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;$10,000.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">

&nbsp;
</TD>

</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -4pt; margin-left: 4pt">
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;the
    transfer to him of any shares or debentures in the name of the
    Corporation for membership in <BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;any clubs
    or organizations that were designated for the regular use of the
    CEO.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -4pt; margin-left: 4pt">
    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;payment
    of all outstanding and accrued regular and special vacation pay.
</DIV>
</TD>

    of all legal fees and expenses that he may reasonably incur as a
    result of any contesting<BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;of the
    validity or enforceability of or his liability under any
    provision of the agreement<BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;or as a
    result of action taken by him in good faith to enforce his
    rights (provided that he is substantially<BR>
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;successful)
    together with interest thereon.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 12pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Securities held by Mr. Wilson which are convertible or
    exchangeable into securities or shares of the Corporation that
    are not then exercisable (&#147;<B>Unexercised
    Rights</B>&#148;), shall be accelerated so that the Unexercised
    Rights shall become immediately exercisable and shall remain
    exercisable for a period of four years following the date of
    notification of his termination or the expiry of such securities
    (whichever occurs first).  All PSUs held by Mr. Wilson shall
    vest immediately and Mr. Wilson shall be paid the market value
    of such PSUs as at the date of termination.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -9pt; margin-left: 9pt">
    <B>Disability</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    In the event of termination due to a disability, Mr. Wilson is
    entitled to receive, until age 60, a monthly payment equal to
    70% of his monthly base salary at the date of termination, less
    the amount of any disability insurance payments received by
    him.  In addition, Mr. Wilson shall receive payment of all
    amounts earned or accrued to the date of termination, including
    all PSUs earned or vested as of the date of termination.  All
    securities held by Mr. Wilson which are convertible or
    exchangeable into securities or shares of the Corporation that
    are not then exercisable (&#147;<B>Unexercised
    Rights</B>&#148;), shall be accelerated so that the Unexercised
    Rights shall become immediately exercisable and shall remain
    exercisable for a period of four years following the date of
    notification of his termination or the expiry of such securities
    (whichever occurs first).  All PSUs held by him shall vest
    immediately and he shall be paid the market value of such PSUs
    as at the date of termination.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Death</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    In the event of Mr. Wilson&#146;s death and if the amount of the
    life insurance then in place on Mr. Wilson&#146;s life is less
    than two times his annual base salary at the date of death, the
    Corporation shall pay to Mr. Wilson&#146;s estate an amount
    equal to the shortfall.  In addition, Mr. Wilson&#146;s estate
    shall receive payment of all amounts earned or accrued to the
    date of termination, including all options and PSUs earned or
    vested (in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan) as
    of the date of termination.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">

    cause</B>
</TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    In the event of the termination of Mr. Wilson&#146;s employment
    for cause, payments are limited to the payment of all amounts
    earned or accrued to the date of termination, including all
    options and PSUs earned or vested (in accordance with the terms
    of the applicable plan) as of the date of termination.
</TD>
</TR>

&nbsp;
</TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Mr. Wilson is required to provide 60&#160;days&#146; prior
    written notice of his resignation and will receive payment of
    all amounts earned or accrued to the date of resignation,
    including all options and PSUs earned or vested (in accordance
    with the terms of the applicable plan) as of the effective date
    of resignation.
</TD>

<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>Confidentiality,<BR>
    Non-solicitation<BR>
    and Non-competition</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    Mr. Wilson will be subject to post-employment covenants
    restricting his use and disclosure of proprietary information,
    and prohibiting post-employment competition and solicitation of
    employees for a period of one year following the termination of
    his employment. The covenant prohibiting post-employment
    competition does not apply if Mr. Wilson resigns or is
    terminated after May 13, 2010.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Mr. Wilson agreed that within five years of the effective date
    of the employment agreement he would own a minimum of 225,000
    common shares and will maintain such ownership throughout the
    balance of the term of the agreement. PSUs granted to Mr. Wilson
    shall count towards this ownership requirement.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">

    <B>Annual Evaluation</B>
</DIV>

<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>

</TD>

    The HR&#038;C Committee is required to complete an annual
    written performance evaluation of Mr. Wilson&#146;s performance
    as the CEO and to meet with him to discuss his performance.
</TD>

</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    The HR&#038;C Committee is required to meet prior to April of
    each year to establish (i) Mr. Wilson&#146;s salary for the
    current year, (ii) the amount of any incentive bonus for the
    previous calendar year, and (iii) the number of options, PSUs
    and other long-term incentives to be awarded for the current
    year.
</TD>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Notes:</FONT></B>
</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(1)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">&#147;<B>Constructive
    Dismissal</B>&#148; means (a)&#160;the assignment of any duties
    materially inconsistent with the CEO&#146;s position duties,
    responsibilities and status with the Corporation, (b)&#160;a
    reduction in the CEO salary without consent, except where such
    reduction or change is applicable to senior officers generally,
    (c)&#160;the failure of the Corporation to continue any benefit,
    bonus or other profit sharing compensation plan that the CEO is
    entitled to participate in, unless such change is applicable to
    senior officers generally, (d)&#160;the relocation of the CEO to
    any place other than the location at which he performed his
    duties immediately prior there to, except for required travel on
    the Corporation&#146;s business to an extent substantially
    consistent with the CEO&#146;s position and duties, (e)&#160;any
    other change that would constitute a constructive dismissal at
    law, (f)&#160;following a Change of Control, if the Company
    fails within ninety days to respond to a written request of the
    executive to provide an effective assumption of its obligation
    under the employment agreement.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(2)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">&#147;<B>Change of
    Control</B>&#148; means a change in the legal or effective
    control of the Corporation, the creation of a control block or
    the coming into existence of a controlling party, in any manner
    whatsoever, whether as a result of, or in connection with, a
    take-over bid, amalgamation, arrangement, merger, other form of
    business combination, asset disposition, contested election of
    directors, or any combination of the foregoing transactions, or
    otherwise, and without limiting the foregoing, a change of
    control shall conclusively be deemed to have occurred upon the
    occurrence of any of the following events: (a)&#160;any
    acquisition (direct or indirect) of securities of the
    Corporation, amalgamation, arrangement, merger or other business
    combination or transaction which results in a person or group
    becoming a control block of the Corporation such that the person
    or group exercises control over 25% or more of the votes
    attaching to all voting securities of the Corporation;
    (b)&#160;the sale, transfer or other disposition, in a single or
    series of transactions, of (i)&#160;assets of the Corporation
    having market value equal to 50% of the market value of the
    Corporation or (ii)&#160;assets comprising all or substantially
    all of a business segment or division of the Corporation (but
    only with respect to the executives responsible for such
    business segment or division); (c)&#160;any amalgamation,
    arrangement, merger, reorganization, other business combination
    or any other transaction unless those persons who were
    shareholders of the Corporation immediately prior to the
    implementation of such transaction own at least 60% of the
    shares or other equity interests in the Corporation or any
    resulting entity; (d)&#160;a change in the composition of the
    Board as a result of a contested election of directors, with the
    result that the persons who were directors of the Corporation
    prior to such contested election do not constitute a majority of
    the directors elected; or (e)&#160;the Board adopts a resolution
    to the effect that, for the purposes of the employment
    agreement, a change of control has occurred or is imminent.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Agrium&#146;s senior executives (with the exception of Michael
    M. Wilson whose employment is governed by an employment
    agreement as described above) have entered into Executive
    Supplemental Pension, Change of Control and Severance
    Compensation Agreements. The key terms are as follows:
</DIV>

<!-- XBRL Table Pagebreak -->

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 9pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<!-- TableOutputHead -->
<!-- TableOutputBody -->
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
    <B>Termination or<BR>
    Constructive<BR>
    Dismissal<BR>
    </B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
In the event that an officer:<BR><BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -0pt; margin-left: 0pt;">
(i)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;is terminated by the Corporation without cause, or<BR><BR>
</DIV>
<DIV style="text-indent: -27pt; margin-left: 27pt;">
(ii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;terminates his or her employment after the occurrence of an event of constructive dismissal<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">(1)</SUP>

</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 9pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    the officer will be entitled to payment of all amounts earned or
    accrued by the officer to the date of termination, plus payment
    of compensation equal to 1/12 of his or her base salary, target
    annual incentives, monthly benefits, perks and 1/12 of all
    pension contributions that would have been paid by Agrium,
    multiplied by the lesser of 24&#160;months or the number of
    months remaining from the termination date to the attainment of
    age 60 (the &#147;<B>Termination Period</B>&#148;).
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 9pt">
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    In addition, the officer will receive (i) additional credited
    service equal to the length of the Termination Period under the
    Canadian DB SERP or U.S. DB SERP (as applicable), (ii) a cash
    amount equal to the market value of the officer&#146;s vested
    PSUs determined as of the termination date, on the basis that
    all of the PSUs in the officer&#146;s PSU account shall be
    considered to be vested as of such date. The executive shall not
    be entitled to be granted any additional PSUs for the
    Termination Period. The vesting and expiry of any SARs held by
    the officer shall be determined by the SARs plan and the officer
    will not be entitled to additional SARs for the Termination
    Period. The vesting and expiry of options and tandem SARs shall
    be determined by the Stock Option Plan and the officer will not
    be entitled to any grants of SARs for the Termination Period. In
    addition, the officer will be entitled to career counselling
    services for a period of up to six months following the
    termination date.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    <B>Termination or<BR>
    Constructive<BR>
    Dismissal after a<BR>
    Change of Control</B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    If within two years of a change of ownership or
    control<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">(2)</SUP>:<BR>

    <BR>
    (i)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;the
    Corporation terminates an officer&#146;s employment without
    cause, or<BR>
    <BR>
    (ii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;an officer
    is constructively dismissed,<BR>
    <BR>
    the officer will be entitled to the compensation amounts
    identified under Termination or Constructive Dismissal (above)
    for the Termination Period. In addition to the above
    compensation,<BR>
    <BR>
    (a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;all
    outstanding unexercised SARs, stock options, tandem SARs held by
    the officer shall immediately become exercisable, and<BR>
    <BR>
    (b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Agrium shall
    indemnify and save the executive harmless from all liability,
    damages, costs, etc. reasonably incurred by the executive in
    connection with an action to enforce or interpret the agreement
    and shall reimburse the executive for all costs.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top">
<DIV style="text-indent: -9pt; margin-left: 9pt">
    <B>Termination for Cause</B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Payments are limited to all amounts earned or accrued to the
    date of termination, including all options and PSUs earned or
    vested (in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan) as
    of the date of termination.
</TD>
</TR>
