<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The U.S.&#160;PSU Plan contains certain additional provisions to
    comply with Section&#160;409A requirements which, among other
    items, provide that payments to U.S.&#160;&#147;specified
    employees&#148; (generally a &#147;key employee&#148; as defined
    in U.S.&#160;Code Section&#160;416(i) and as determined in
    accordance with the Treasury Regulations under
    Section&#160;409A) cannot begin until six months after the
    specified employee&#146;s separation of service from employment
    with the Corporation (i.e. such payments would begin on or after
    the first day of the seventh month coincident with or next
    following the date of retirement or termination of employment).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The grant of PSUs does not entitle the Holder to any right as a
    shareholder. The interests of any designated employee under the
    PSU Plans or any PSUs are not transferable or assignable.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The PSU Plans contain provisions for certain adjustments in the
    event of a corporate reorganization or change in ownership or
    control, including, among other instances, an amalgamation or
    merger of the Corporation or a take-over bid for the Corporation.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    E-8
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">DSU
    GRANT PLAN</FONT></U></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">


</DIV>
<DIV style="width: 100%; border-top: 1px solid #000000; padding-top: 1pt; border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 1pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; padding-bottom: 1pt; border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 1pt"><!-- Begin box 3 -->

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>Shareholder Tip: What is a deferred share unit or DSU?</B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
     A deferred share unit or DSU is similar to a PSU in that the
    value of a DSU is tied to the value of Agrium&#146;s Common
    Shares. A DSU is a notional security, equivalent to the value of
    a Common Share, and does not entitle the holder to voting or
    other shareholder rights, other than the accrual of additional
    DSUs for the value of dividends. A director cannot redeem
    deferred share units until the director ceases to be a member of
    the Board, following which DSUs will be redeemed for cash value
    equal to the Market Value (defined below) of the notional Common
    Shares represented by such DSUs.
</DIV>
</DIV><!-- End box 3 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 15pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following is a summary of the Amended and Restated
    Directors&#146; Deferred Share Unit Grant Plan (the &#147;<B>DSU
    Grant Plan</B>&#148;) which was adopted by the Corporation on
    May&#160;8, 2002 (as subsequently amended).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The DSU Grant Plan authorizes the Board to grant DSUs to
    non-executive directors of Agrium. As of the date of the
    Circular, there are 130,739 DSUs issued and outstanding under
    the DSU Grant Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    DSUs are fully vested upon grant and each granted DSU gives the
    designated director (the &#147;<B>Holder</B>&#148;) the right to
    receive a payment equal to the Market Value of such DSU when the
    Holder ceases to be a Director. The DSU market value (the
    &#147;<B>Market Value</B>&#148;) is the average closing price of
    a Common Share on the TSX over the ten trading days prior to the
    last date on which at least one board lot of Common Shares was
    traded. The Corporation maintains an account (a &#147;<B>DSU
    Grant Account</B>&#148;) for each director, which is credited
    with the grants of DSUs received by a director pursuant to the
    DSU Grant Plan. Whenever cash dividends are paid on the Common
    Shares, additional equivalent DSUs are credited to Holders. The
    number of additional DSUs so credited are calculated by dividing
    the cash dividends that would have been paid to such Holder if
    the DSUs held by the Holder at the record date of the dividend
    were Common Shares.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    DSUs become redeemable 30&#160;days after the termination date
    (the &#147;<B>Director&#146;s Termination Date</B>&#148;), which
    is the date on which the Holder ceases to be a director and an
    employee of the Corporation for any reason including retirement
    or death. A Canadian Holder or
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">his/her</FONT>
    beneficiary (in the event of the Holder&#146;s death) may then
    elect to redeem the DSUs by filing written elections to redeem
    the DSUs as of a specified date or dates (each such date an
    &#147;<B>Entitlement Date</B>&#148;). U.S.&#160;Holders must
    complete and deliver to the Corporation an irrevocable written
    election selecting up to a maximum of two redemption dates (both
    redemption dates to be within the period commencing 30&#160;days
    after ceasing to be a director of the Corporation to December 15
    of the calendar year following the year in which the director
    ceased to be a director of the Corporation), which election must
    be delivered to the Corporation by no later than December 31 of
    the calendar year prior to the calendar year to which the
    election relates. Such election shall be effective for DSUs
    payable under the DSU Grant Plan during the ensuing calendar
    year immediately following the delivery of the election to the
    Corporation. New U.S.&#160;directors are required to provide
    their initial election within thirty (30)&#160;days after
    becoming a director. Holders must elect to redeem DSUs prior to
    December 15 of the calendar year following the year in which the
    Director&#146;s Termination Date occurs (the &#147;<B>Final
    Date</B>&#148;) and, if no written election is made prior to
    that time, the DSUs shall automatically be redeemed as of the
    Final Date. A Holder who has redeemed DSUs will receive a cash
    payment (less withholding tax and other source deductions) equal
    to the Market Value of the redeemed DSUs as of the Entitlement
    Date or Final Date, as applicable.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The grant of DSUs does not entitle the Holder to any rights as a
    shareholder. The interests of any designated employee under the
    DSU Grant Plan or any DSUs are not assignable except by
    operation of law.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The DSU Grant Plan contains provisions for certain adjustments
    in the event of a corporate reorganization or change in
    ownership or control, including, among other instances, an
    amalgamation or merger of the Corporation or a take-over bid for
    the Corporation.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    E-9
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">DSU
    FEE PLAN</FONT></U></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following is a summary of the Directors&#146; Deferred Share
    Unit Fee Plan (the &#147;<B>DSU Fee Plan</B>&#148;) which was
    adopted by the Corporation on January&#160;1, 2002 (as
    subsequently amended).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The DSU Fee Plan allows non-executive directors to elect to
    receive the cash portion of their remuneration in the form of
    DSUs, cash, or any combination thereof. Director&#146;s
    remuneration is payable quarterly and, to the extent a director
    elects to receive DSUs, such DSUs shall be credited to the
    Director&#146;s DSU Fee Account on the last business day of each
    quarter (the &#147;<B>Conversion Date</B>&#148;), being the last
    business day of each three month period ending March&#160;31,
    June&#160;30, September 30 and December&#160;31. The number of
    DSUs (including fractional DSUs) issued on each Conversion Date
    is calculated by dividing the amount of the electing
    director&#146;s cash remuneration to be paid in DSUs by the
    Market Value (defined below) of the Common Shares on the
    Conversion Date. As of the date of this Circular, there are
    63,776 DSUs issued and outstanding under the DSU Fee Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    DSUs are fully vested upon grant and each granted DSU gives the
    designated director (the &#147;<B>Holder</B>&#148;) the right to
    receive a payment equal to the Market Value of such DSU when the
    Holder ceases to be a director. The DSU market value (the
    &#147;<B>Market Value</B>&#148;) is the average closing price of
    a Common Share on the TSX over the ten trading days prior to the
    last date on which at least one board lot of Common Shares was
    traded. The Corporation maintains an account (a &#147;<B>DSU Fee
    Account</B>&#148;) for each director, which is credited with
    notional grants of DSUs received by a director. Whenever cash
    dividends are paid on the Common Shares, additional DSUs are
    credited to Holders. The number of additional DSUs so credited
    are calculated by dividing the cash dividends that would have
    been paid to such Holder if the DSUs held by the Holder at the
    record date of the dividend were Common Shares.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    DSUs become redeemable 30&#160;days after the termination date
    (&#147;<B>Director&#146;s Termination Date</B>&#148;), which is
    the date on which the Holder ceases to be a director and an
    employee of the Corporation for any reason including retirement
    or death. A Canadian Holder or
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">his/her</FONT>
    beneficiary (in the event of the Holder&#146;s death) may then
    elect to redeem the DSUs by filing written elections to redeem
    the DSUs as of a specified date or dates (each such date an
    &#147;<B>Entitlement Date</B>&#148;). To elect to receive all or
    some portion of a director&#146;s quarterly remuneration in
    respect of a quarter, U.S.&#160;Holders must complete and
    deliver to the Corporation an irrevocable written election
    selecting up to a maximum of two redemption dates (the
    redemption date(s) to be within the period commencing
    30&#160;days after ceasing to be a director of the Corporation
    to December 15 of the calendar year following the year in which
    the director ceased to be a director of the Corporation), by no
    later than December 31 of the calendar year prior to the
    calendar year of the first quarter to which the election
    relates. Such election shall be effective for the
    U.S.&#160;Holder&#146;s quarterly director remuneration payable
    in respect of all quarters commencing after the first quarter to
    which the new written election relates (unless subsequently
    changed in accordance with the DSU Fee Plan). Holders must elect
    to redeem DSUs prior to December 15 of the calendar year
    following the year in which the Director&#146;s Termination Date
    occurs (the &#147;<B>Final Date</B>&#148;) and, if no written
    election is made prior to that time, the DSUs shall
    automatically be redeemed as of the Final Date. A Holder who has
    redeemed DSUs will receive a cash payment (less withholding tax
    and other source deductions) equal to the Market Value of the
    redeemed DSUs as of the Entitlement Date or Final Date, as
    applicable.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The grant of DSUs does not entitle the Holder to any rights as a
    shareholder. The interests of any designated employee under the
    DSU Fee Plan or any DSUs are not transferable or assignable
    except by operation of law.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The DSU Fee Plan contains provisions for certain adjustments in
    the event of a corporate reorganization or change in ownership
    or control, including, among other instances, an amalgamation or
    merger of the Corporation or a take-over bid for the Corporation.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    E-10
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">


    <A name='183'><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">SCHEDULE
    &#147;F&#148;</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #1EB53A">SUMMARY
    OF 2010 RIGHTS PLAN</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following is a summary of the terms and conditions of the
    2010 Rights Plan. The summary is qualified in its entirety by,
    and is subject to, the full text of the Amended and Restated
    Shareholder Rights Plan Agreement dated effective as of
    May&#160;12, 2010 between Agrium Inc. and CIBC Mellon
    Trust&#160;Company. A complete copy of the 2010 Rights Plan is
    available upon request. Shareholders wishing to receive a copy
    of the 2010 Rights Plan should make their request by telephone
    at
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">(403)&#160;225-7000,</FONT>
    by facsimile at
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">(403)&#160;225-7609,</FONT>
    by email at investor@agrium.inc or by mail to Agrium Inc., at
    13131 Lake Fraser Drive S.E., Calgary, Alberta, Canada T2J 7E8,
    Attention: Corporate Secretary. All capitalized terms where used
    in this summary without definition have the meanings attributed
    to them in the 2010 Rights Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(a)&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Issuance
    of Rights</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Under the 2010 Rights Plan, the rights granted under the
    predecessor rights plans of the Corporation dated March&#160;1,
    1995, March&#160;2, 1998, May&#160;9, 2001 and April&#160;28,
    2004 and May&#160;9, 2007, respectively, and which are
    outstanding at the Record Time of 5:00&#160;p.m. (Calgary time)
    on May&#160;12, 2010, will expire at the time that the Meeting
    terminates, and the Rights will be issued as at the Record Time
    on the terms set out in the 2010 Rights Plan to holders of each
    &#147;Voting Share&#148; (which includes the Common Shares and
    any other shares in or interests of the Corporation entitled to
    vote generally in the election of directors) outstanding as at
    the Record Time and of those issued thereafter and prior to the
    Separation Time (as defined below), subject to the earlier
    termination or expiration of the Rights as set out in the 2010
    Rights Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(b)&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Exercise
    Price</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Until the Separation Time, the exercise price (&#147;<B>Exercise
    Price</B>&#148;) of each Right is three times the market price,
    from time to time, of the Common Shares. From and after the
    Separation Time, the Exercise Price is three times the market
    price, as at the Separation Time, per Common Share. The Exercise
    Price is subject to adjustment as set out in the 2010 Rights
    Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    On a Flip-In Event (as defined below) occurring, the Exercise
    Price will be for such number of Common Shares as have an
    aggregate market price equal to twice the Exercise Price,
    subject to any anti-dilution adjustments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(c)&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Term</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The 2010 Rights Plan will take effect at the time that the
    Meeting terminates (the &#147;<B>Effective Date</B>&#148;), and
    will expire at the time and on the date that the annual meeting
    of shareholders to be held in 2013 terminates, subject to
    earlier termination or expiration of the Rights as set out in
    the 2010 Rights Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Notwithstanding the foregoing, if the 2010 Rights Plan is not
    approved at the Meeting, the 2010 Rights Plan will terminate at
    the Meeting and the Company will no longer have any form of
    shareholder rights plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(d)&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Trading
    of Rights</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Until the Separation Time, the Rights will be evidenced by the
    certificates representing the associated Voting Shares and will
    be transferable only together with the associated Voting Shares.
    After the Separation Time, separate certificates evidencing the
    Rights will be mailed to holders of record of Voting Shares as
    of the Separation Time and Voting Shares issued on conversion of
    Convertible Securities after the Separation Time and prior to
    the Expiration Time, promptly after such conversion (other than
    to any shareholder or group of shareholders making a take-over
    bid) as of the Separation Time and such separate Rights
    certificates alone will evidence the Rights. The Rights will be
    listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange and the New York Stock
    Exchange, subject to the Corporation complying with the
    requirements of each exchange.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-1
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(e)&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Separation
    Time</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Rights are not exercisable and do not trade separately from
    their associated Voting Shares until the &#147;<B>Separation
    Time</B>&#148;. The &#147;Separation Time&#148; is the close of
    business on the tenth trading day after the earliest of
    (i)&#160;the Stock Acquisition Date, which is the first date of
    public announcement of facts indicating that a person has become
    an Acquiring Person (as defined below); (ii)&#160;the date of
    the commencement of, or first public announcement of the current
    intention of any person (other than the Corporation or any
    subsidiary of the Corporation) to commence, a take-over bid
    (other than a Permitted Bid or a Competing Permitted Bid, each
    as defined below); and (iii)&#160;the date upon which a
    Permitted Bid or a Competing Permitted Bid ceases to be one. The
    Separation Time can also be such later date as may from time to
    time be determined by the Board of Directors.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(f)&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Acquiring
    Person</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    An &#147;<B>Acquiring Person</B>&#148; is a person who is the
    Beneficial Owner (as defined below) of 20% or more of the then
    outstanding Voting Shares. Excluded from the definition of
    Acquiring Person are the Corporation and its subsidiaries and
    any person who becomes the Beneficial Owner of 20% or more of
    the then outstanding Voting Shares as a result of one or any
    combination of a Voting Share Reduction, a Permitted Bid
    Acquisition, an Exempt Acquisition, a Convertible Security
    Acquisition or a Pro Rata Acquisition. In general:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (i)&#160;a &#147;<B>Voting Share Reduction</B>&#148; means an
    acquisition or a redemption by the Corporation of Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities which, by reducing the number of Voting
    Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities outstanding, increases the percentage of
    Voting Shares&#160;Beneficially Owned by any person;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (ii)&#160;a &#147;<B>Permitted Bid Acquisition</B>&#148; means
    an acquisition by a person of Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities made pursuant to a Permitted Bid or a
    Competing Permitted Bid;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (iii)&#160;an &#147;<B>Exempt Acquisition</B>&#148; means an
    acquisition by a person of Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities: (i)&#160;in respect of which the Board
    of Directors has waived the application of the 2010 Rights Plan;
    (ii)&#160;pursuant to a dividend reinvestment plan;
    (iii)&#160;pursuant to a distribution of Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities made by the Corporation (a)&#160;to the
    public pursuant to a prospectus; provided that such person does
    not thereby become the Beneficial Owner of a greater percentage
    of Voting Shares so offered than the percentage of Voting
    Shares&#160;Beneficially Owned by such person immediately prior
    to such distribution, or (b)&#160;by way of a private placement;
    provided that, among other things, such person does not thereby
    become the Beneficial Owner of Voting Shares equal in number to
    more than 25% of the Voting Shares outstanding immediately prior
    to the private placement and, in making this determination, the
    securities to be issued to such person on the private placement
    shall be deemed to be held by such person but shall not be
    included in the aggregate number of Voting Shares outstanding
    immediately prior to the private placement; or
    (iv)&#160;pursuant to an amalgamation, merger, arrangement or
    other statutory procedure requiring shareholder approval;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (iv)&#160;a &#147;<B>Convertible Security Acquisition</B>&#148;
    means an acquisition of Voting Shares by a person upon the
    purchase, exercise, conversion or exchange of Convertible
    Securities acquired or received by such person pursuant to a
    Permitted Bid Acquisition, an Exempt Acquisition or a Pro Rata
    Acquisition;&#160;and
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (v)&#160;a &#147;<B>Pro Rata Acquisition</B>&#148; means an
    acquisition by a person of Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities as a result of a stock dividend, a stock
    split or a rights offering issued on the same pro rata basis to
    all the holders of Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities of the same class or series; provided
    that such person does not thereby become the Beneficial Owner of
    a greater percentage of Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities than the percentage of Voting
    Shares&#160;Beneficially Owned by such person immediately prior
    to such acquisition.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Also excluded from the definition of Acquiring Person are
    underwriters or banking or selling group members acting in
    connection with a distribution of securities and any
    &#147;<B>Grandfathered Person</B>&#148; (generally, any person
    who is the Beneficial Owner of 20% or more of the then
    outstanding Voting Shares at the Record Time). To the
    Corporation&#146;s knowledge, there are no Grandfathered Persons.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(g)&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Beneficial
    Ownership</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In general, a person is deemed to &#147;<B>Beneficially
    Own</B>&#148; securities actually held by others in
    circumstances where those holdings are or should be grouped
    together for purposes of the 2010 Rights Plan. Included are
    holdings
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-2
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    by the person&#146;s &#147;<B>Affiliates</B>&#148; (generally, a
    person that controls, is controlled by, or is under common
    control with a specified person) and
    &#147;<B>Associates</B>&#148; (generally, relatives sharing the
    same residence). Also included are securities that the person or
    any of the person&#146;s Affiliates or Associates has the right
    to acquire within 60&#160;days (other than customary agreements
    with and between underwriters and banking group or selling group
    members with respect to a distribution of securities and other
    than pursuant to pledges of securities in the ordinary course of
    business).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    A person is also deemed to Beneficially Own any securities that
    are Beneficially Owned (as described above) by any other person
    with which, and in respect of which security, such person is
    acting jointly or in concert. A person is acting jointly or in
    concert with any other person who is a party to an agreement,
    commitment, arrangement or understanding with the first person
    for the purpose of acquiring or offering to acquire Voting
    Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(h)&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Exclusions
    from the Definition of Beneficial Ownership</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The definition of &#147;<B>Beneficial Ownership</B>&#148;
    contains several exclusions whereby a person is not considered
    to Beneficially Own a security. There are exemptions from the
    deemed Beneficial Ownership provisions for institutional
    shareholders acting in the ordinary course of business and the
    performance of their duties. These exemptions apply to:
    (i)&#160;an investment manager (&#147;<B>Manager</B>&#148;)
    which holds securities in the performance of the Manager&#146;s
    duties for the account of any other person (a
    &#147;Client&#148;); (ii)&#160;a licensed trust company
    (&#147;<B>Trust&#160;Company</B>&#148;) acting as trustee or
    administrator or in a similar capacity for the estates of
    deceased or incompetent persons (each an &#147;<B>Estate
    Account</B>&#148;) or in relation to other accounts (each an
    &#147;<B>Other Account</B>&#148;); (iii)&#160;a person
    established by statute (a &#147;<B>Statutory Body</B>&#148;),
    the ordinary business or activity of which includes the
    management of investment funds for employee benefit plans,
    retirement plans and insurance plans (other than insurance plans
    administered by insurance companies) of various public bodies;
    and (iv)&#160;the administrator
    (&#147;<B>Administrator</B>&#148;) of one or more pension funds
    or plans (a &#147;<B>Plan</B>&#148;) registered under applicable
    law. The foregoing exemptions apply only so long as the Manager,
    Trust&#160;Company, Administrator or Plan is not then making or
    has not then publicly announced an intention to make a take-over
    bid, other than pursuant to a distribution by the Corporation or
    by means of ordinary market transactions. Also, a person will
    not be deemed to &#147;<B>Beneficially Own</B>&#148; a security
    because such person: (i)&#160;is a Client of the same Manager,
    an Estate Account or an Other Account of the same
    Trust&#160;Company, or a Plan with the same Administrator as
    another person or Plan on whose account the Manager,
    Trust&#160;Company or Administrator, as the case may be, holds
    such security; or (ii)&#160;is a Client of a Manager, Estate
    Account, Other Account or Plan, and the security is owned at law
    or in equity by the Manager, Trust&#160;Company, Administrator
    or Plan, as the case may be.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    A person will not be deemed to &#147;<B>Beneficially
    Own</B>&#148; any securities that are the subject of a Permitted
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT>
    Agreement. A &#147;<B>Permitted
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT>
    Agreement</B>&#148; is an agreement (the
    &#147;<B><FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT>
    Agreement</B>&#148;) between a person and one or more holders of
    Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities (each a
    &#147;<B><FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Locked-Up</FONT>
    Person</B>&#148;) pursuant to which such
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Locked-Up</FONT>
    Person agrees to deposit or tender Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities to a take-over bid (the
    &#147;<B><FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT>
    Bid</B>&#148;) made or to be made by the person or any of such
    person&#146;s Affiliates or Associates or any other person with
    which, and in respect of which security, such person is acting
    jointly or in concert, provided that:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (i)&#160;the terms of such
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT>
    Agreement are publicly disclosed and a copy is made available to
    the public (including the Corporation) not later than the date
    of the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT> Bid
    or, if the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT> Bid
    has been made prior to the date on which such
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT>
    Agreement is entered into, not later than the date of such
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT>
    Agreement (or, if such date is not a business day, on the
    business day next following such date);
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (ii)&#160;the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT>
    Agreement permits such
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Locked-Up</FONT>
    Person to terminate its obligation to deposit or tender to or
    not to withdraw Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities from the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT> Bid,
    and to terminate any obligation with respect to the voting of
    such securities, in order to deposit or tender such securities
    to another take-over bid or to support another transaction:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 8%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (1)&#160;where the price or value of the consideration per
    Voting Share or Convertible Security offered under such other
    take-over bid or transaction:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 13%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (A)&#160;exceeds the price or value of the consideration per
    Voting Share or Convertible Security offered under the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT>
    Bid;&#160;or
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 13%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (B)&#160;exceeds by as much as or more than a specified amount
    (the &#147;<B>Specified Amount</B>&#148;) the price or value of
    the consideration per Voting Share or Convertible Security at
    which the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Locked-Up</FONT>
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-3
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 13%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Person has agreed to deposit or tender Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities to the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT> Bid,
    provided that such Specified Amount is not greater than 7% of
    the price or value of the consideration per Voting Share or
    Convertible Security offered under the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT>
    Bid;&#160;and
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 8%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (2)&#160;if the number of Voting Shares or Convertible
    Securities offered to be purchased under the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT> Bid
    is less than 100% of the Voting Shares or Convertible Securities
    held by Independent Shareholders, where the price or value of
    the consideration per Voting Share or Convertible Security
    offered under such other take-over bid or transaction is not
    less than the price or value of the consideration per Voting
    Share or Convertible Security offered under the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT> Bid
    and the number of Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities to be purchased under such other
    take-over bid or transaction:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 13%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (A)&#160;exceeds the number of Voting Shares or Convertible
    Securities that the Offeror has offered to purchase under the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT>
    Bid;&#160;or
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 13%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (B)&#160;exceeds by as much as or more than a specified number
    (the &#147;<B>Specified Number</B>&#148;) the number of Voting
    Shares or Convertible Securities that the Offeror has offered to
    purchase under the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT> Bid,
    provided that the Specified Number is not greater than 7% of the
    number of Voting Shares or Convertible Securities offered under
    the <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT>
    Bid;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 8%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    and for greater certainty, such
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT>
    Agreement may contain a right of first refusal or require a
    period of delay to give the Offeror under the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT> Bid
    an opportunity to match the higher price, value or number in
    such other take-over bid or transaction, or other similar
    limitation on a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Locked-Up</FONT>
    Person&#146;s right to withdraw Voting Shares from the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT>
    Agreement, so long as the limitation does not preclude the
    exercise by the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Locked-Up</FONT>
    Person of the right to withdraw Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities in sufficient time to deposit or tender
    to the other take-over bid or support the other
    transaction;&#160;and
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (iii)&#160;no
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">&#147;break-up&#148;</FONT>
    fees,
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">&#147;top-up&#148;</FONT>
    fees, penalties, expenses or other amounts that exceed in the
    aggregate the greater of:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 8%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (1)&#160;the cash equivalent of 2.5% of the price or value of
    the consideration payable under the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT> Bid
    to a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Locked-Up</FONT>
    Person;&#160;and
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 8%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (2)&#160;50% of the amount by which the price or value of the
    consideration payable under another take-over bid or other
    transaction to a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Locked-Up</FONT>
    Person exceeds the price or value of the consideration that such
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Locked-Up</FONT>
    Person would have received under the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT> Bid,
    shall be payable by a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Locked-Up</FONT>
    Person pursuant to the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT>
    Agreement in the event that the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Locked-Up</FONT>
    Bid is not successfully concluded or if any
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Locked-Up</FONT>
    Person fails to deposit or tender Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities to the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Lock-Up</FONT> Bid
    or withdraws Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities previously deposited or tendered thereto
    in order to deposit or tender to another take-over bid or
    support another transaction.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(i)&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Flip-In
    Event</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    A &#147;<B>Flip-In Event</B>&#148; occurs when any person
    becomes an Acquiring Person. If a Flip-In Event occurs prior to
    the Expiration Time that has not been waived by the Board of
    Directors (see &#147;<B>Waiver</B>&#148;, below), each Right
    (except for Rights Beneficially Owned or which may thereafter be
    Beneficially Owned by an Acquiring Person, or an Affiliate or
    Associate of an Acquiring Person, or any person acting jointly
    or in concert with an Acquiring Person or any Affiliate or
    Associate of such other person, or a transferee of any such
    person, which Rights will become null and void) shall constitute
    the right to purchase from the Corporation, on payment of the
    Exercise Price, Voting Shares having an aggregate market price
    equal to twice the Exercise Price, for an amount in cash equal
    to the Exercise Price, subject to anti-dilution adjustments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(j)&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Permitted
    Bid and Competing Permitted Bid</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    A take-over bid will not trigger a Flip-In Event if it is a
    Permitted Bid or Competing Permitted Bid. A &#147;<B>Permitted
    Bid</B>&#148; is a take-over bid made by an Offeror by way of a
    take-over bid circular to all holders of Voting
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-4
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Shares on the books of the Corporation (other than the Offeror)
    and which complies with the following additional provisions:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (i)&#160;no Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities shall be taken up or paid for pursuant to
    the take-over bid prior to the close of business on a date which
    is not less than 60&#160;days after the offer date of the
    take-over bid;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (ii)&#160;outstanding Voting Shares and Convertible Securities
    held by Independent Shareholders representing more than 50% of
    the aggregate of (A)&#160;then outstanding Voting Shares and
    (B)&#160;Voting Shares issuable upon the exercise of Convertible
    Securities, have been deposited or tendered and not withdrawn,
    and have previously been or are taken up at the same time;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (iii)&#160;unless the take-over bid is withdrawn, Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities may be deposited or tendered pursuant to
    the take-over bid at any time prior to the close of business on
    the date of first takeup or payment for Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities and all Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities deposited or tendered pursuant to the
    take-over bid may be withdrawn at any time prior to the close of
    business on such date;&#160;and
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (iv)&#160;in the event that (ii)&#160;is satisfied as at the
    date of first
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">take-up</FONT> or
    payment for Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities under the take-over bid, the Offeror will
    make a public announcement of that fact and the take-over bid
    will remain open for deposits and tenders of Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities for not less than 10 business days from
    the date of such public announcement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    A Competing Permitted Bid is a take-over bid that is made after
    a Permitted Bid has been made but prior to its expiry,
    termination or withdrawal and that satisfies all the
    requirements of a Permitted Bid as described above, except that
    a Competing Permitted Bid is required to remain open until a
    date that is no earlier than the later of (i)&#160;35&#160;days
    following the date of the take-over bid constituting the
    Competing Permitted Bid, and (ii)&#160;60&#160;days after the
    date on which the earliest Permitted Bid or Competing Permitted
    Bid which preceded the Competing Permitted Bid was made.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 16pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(k)&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Redemption</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Rights may be redeemed in certain circumstances:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (i)&#160;Redemption of Rights on Approval of Holders of Voting
    Shares and Rights. The Board of Directors acting in good faith
    may, with the prior approval of the holders of Voting Shares or
    Rights, at any time prior to the occurrence of a Flip-In Event
    that has not been waived, elect to redeem all but not less than
    all of the outstanding Rights at a redemption price of $0.00001
    per Right (the &#147;Redemption&#160;Price&#148;), subject to
    adjustment for anti-dilution as provided in the 2010 Rights Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    If such redemption of Rights is proposed at any time prior to
    the Separation Time, such redemption or waiver shall be
    submitted for approval to the holders of Voting Shares. Such
    approval shall be deemed to have been given if the redemption or
    waiver is approved by the affirmative vote of a majority of the
    votes cast by Independent Shareholders.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    If such redemption of Rights is proposed at any time after the
    Separation Time, such redemption shall be submitted for approval
    to the holders of Rights. Such approval shall be deemed to have
    been given if the redemption is approved by holders of Rights by
    a majority of the votes cast by the holders of Rights (other
    than Rights which are Beneficially Owned by any Person who would
    not qualify as an Independent Shareholder).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (ii)&#160;Deemed Redemption. If a person who has made a
    Permitted Bid, a Competing Permitted Bid or an Exempt
    Acquisition in respect of which the Board of Directors has
    waived or has been deemed to have waived the application of the
    2010 Rights Plan consummates the acquisition of the Voting
    Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities, the Board of Directors shall be deemed
    to have elected to redeem the Rights for the
    Redemption&#160;Price.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (iii)&#160;Redemption of Rights on Withdrawal or Termination of
    Bid. Where a take-over bid that is not a Permitted Bid
    Acquisition expires, is withdrawn or otherwise terminates after
    the Separation Time and prior to the occurrence of a Flip-In
    Event, the Board of Directors may elect to redeem all the
    outstanding Rights at the Redemption Price. Upon the Rights
    being so redeemed, all the provisions of the 2010 Rights Plan
    shall
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-5
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    continue to apply as if the Separation Time had not occurred and
    Rights Certificates had not been mailed, and the Separation Time
    shall be deemed not to have occurred and Rights shall remain
    attached to the outstanding Voting Shares.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 16pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(l)&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Waiver</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Board of Directors may waive the application of the 2010
    Rights Plan in certain circumstances:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (i)&#160;Discretionary Waiver respecting Acquisition not by
    Take-over Bid Circular. The Board of Directors acting in good
    faith may, with the prior approval of the holders of Voting
    Shares, at any time prior to the occurrence of a Flip-In Event
    that would occur by reason of an acquisition of Voting Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Convertible Securities otherwise than pursuant to a take-over
    bid made by means of a take-over bid circular sent to all
    holders of Voting Shares or by inadvertence when such
    inadvertent Acquiring Person has then reduced its holdings to
    below 20%, waive the application of the 2010 Rights Plan to such
    Flip-In Event. If the Board of Directors proposes such a waiver
    it shall extend the Separation Time to a date subsequent to the
    meeting of shareholders but not more than 10 business days
    thereafter.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    If such waiver of Rights is proposed at any time prior to the
    Separation Time, such waiver shall be submitted for approval to
    the holders of Voting Shares. Such approval shall be deemed to
    have been given if the waiver is approved by the affirmative
    vote of a majority of the votes cast by Independent Shareholders.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    If such waiver of Rights is proposed at any time after the
    Separation Time, such waiver shall be submitted for approval to
    the holders of Rights. Such approval shall be deemed to have
    been given if the waiver is approved by holders of Rights by a
    majority of the votes cast by the holders of Rights (other than
    Rights which are Beneficially Owned by any Person who would not
    qualify as an Independent Shareholder).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (ii)&#160;Discretionary Waiver respecting Acquisition by
    Take-over Circular and Mandatory Waiver of Concurrent Bids. The
    Board of Directors may, prior to the occurrence of a Flip-In
    Event that would occur by reason of an acquisition of Voting
    Shares pursuant to a take-over bid made by means of a take-over
    bid circular sent to all holders of Voting Shares, waive the
    application of the 2010 Rights Plan to such a Flip-In Event,
    provided that if the Board of Directors waives the application
    of the 2010 Rights Plan to such a Flip-In Event, the Board of
    Directors shall be deemed to have waived the application of the
    2010 Rights Plan in respect of any other Flip-In Event occurring
    by reason of any such take-over bid made by means of a take-over
    bid circular sent to all holders of Voting Shares prior to the
    expiry of the take-over bid for which a waiver is, or is deemed
    to have been, granted.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (iii)&#160;Waiver of Inadvertent Acquisition. The Board of
    Directors may waive the application of the 2010 Rights Plan in
    respect of the occurrence of any Flip-In Event if (i)&#160;the
    Board of Directors has determined that a person became an
    Acquiring Person under the 2010 Rights Plan by inadvertence and
    without any intent or knowledge that it would become an
    Acquiring Person; and (ii)&#160;the Acquiring Person has reduced
    its Beneficial Ownership of Voting Shares such that at the time
    of waiver the person is no longer an Acquiring Person.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 16pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(m)&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Anti-Dilution
    Adjustments</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Exercise Price of a Right, the number and kind of shares
    subject to purchase upon exercise of a Right, and the number of
    Rights outstanding, will be adjusted in certain events,
    including:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (i)&#160;if there is a dividend payable in Voting Shares or
    Convertible Securities (other than pursuant to any dividend
    reinvestment program) on the Voting Shares, or a subdivision or
    consolidation of the Voting Shares, or an issuance of Voting
    Shares or Convertible Securities in respect of, in lieu of, or
    in exchange for Voting Shares;&#160;or
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 8pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    (ii)&#160;if the Corporation fixes a record date for the
    distribution to all holders of Voting Shares of certain rights,
    options or warrants to acquire Voting Shares or Convertible
    Securities, or for the making of a
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-6
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    distribution to all holders of Voting Shares of evidences of
    indebtedness or assets (other than regular periodic cash
    dividends or stock dividends payable in Voting Shares) or rights
    or warrants.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">(n)&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Supplements
    and Amendments</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Corporation may make changes to the 2010 Rights Plan prior
    to or after the Separation Time to correct any clerical or
    typographical error or to maintain the validity of the 2010
    Rights Plan as a result of any change in any applicable
    legislation, rules or regulation without the approval of the
    holders of the Voting Shares or Rights. The Corporation may also
    make changes to the 2010 Rights Plan prior to the Meeting
    without the approval of the holders of the Voting Shares or the
    Rights that the Board of Directors, acting in good faith, may
    deem necessary or desirable. The Corporation may, with the
    approval of the holders of Voting Shares, at any time prior to
    the Separation Time, make changes to amend, supplement, restate
    or rescind any of the provisions of the 2010 Rights Plan and the
    Rights (whether or not such action would materially adversely
    affect the interests of the holders of Rights generally). The
    Corporation may, with the approval of the holders of Rights, at
    any time after the Separation Time, make changes to amend,
    supplement, restate or rescind any of the provisions of the 2010
    Rights Plan and the Rights (whether or not such action would
    materially adversely affect the interests of the holders of
    Rights generally).
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-7
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">AGRIUM
    INC.<BR>
    INSTRUMENT OF PROXY FOR THE ANNUAL AND SPECIAL MEETING<BR>
    OF SHAREHOLDERS TO BE HELD ON WEDNESDAY, MAY 12, 2010</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 2pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 9pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The undersigned hereby appoints Frank W. Proto or, failing him,
    Michael M. Wilson, or instead of either of the foregoing,
    <U>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</U>&#160;,
    as proxyholder of the undersigned, with full power of
    substitution, to attend, vote and act for and on behalf of the
    undersigned at the Annual and Special Meeting (the
    &#147;<B>Meeting</B>&#148;) of the shareholders (the
    &#147;<B>Shareholders</B>&#148;) of Agrium Inc. (the
    &#147;<B>Corporation</B>&#148;) to be held on May&#160;12, 2010
    at 11:00&#160;a.m. (Calgary time), and at any adjournment of the
    Meeting, and on every ballot that may take place in consequence
    thereof to the same extent and with the same powers as if the
    undersigned were personally present at the Meeting, with
    authority to vote at the proxyholder&#146;s discretion except as
    otherwise specified below:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 2pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Without limiting the general powers hereby conferred, the
    undersigned hereby directs the proxyholder to vote the common
    shares represented by this proxy in the following manner:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 2pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

    <TD width="97%"></TD>

</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 2pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>

</TD>

    all nominees listed below (except as marked to the contrary
    below).

    FROM VOTING for all nominees marked below.
</TD>

<DIV style="margin-top: 1pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 3%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 9pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    INSTRUCTION:&#160;&#160;To withhold from voting on any
